Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 17, Dex 9, Con -, Int 9, Wis 15, Cha 18
Monster.Feats: Ability Focus (fear gaze), Power Attack
Monster.Skills: Climb +10, Perception +9, Swim +15
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Fear Gaze (Su) Shaken, range 30 feet, Will DC 16 negates. This fear effect does not stack with itself. The save DC is Charisma-based. Ranseur As long as Davik Nettles continues to exist, his +1 ranseur cannot be taken from him. If disarmed of the +1 ranseur, or if he drops it, it melts into water–he can retrieve his +1 ranseur by pulling it out of any body of water as a moveequivalent action that provokes an attack of opportunity. If Davik is put to rest permanently, his +1 ranseur loses this ability and can be claimed by someone else.
Monster.DuringCombat: Davik Nettles wants vengeance, and the PCs are a handy tool. If they attack him, he continues to speak his request for the Stag Lord's death, and if the PCs cease their attack and agree to do as Davik commands, the undead creature breaks off his attacks, nods, and melts back into the river. While fighting, Davik relies on his hideous stench and fear gaze to disrupt organized attempts to surround him.
Monster.Morale: Davik fights until destroyed.

Monster.Name: Kressle
Monster.Melee: mwk handaxe +5 (1d6+3/x3), mwk handaxe +5 (1d6+1/x3) or mwk handaxe +7 (1d6+3/x3)
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 16, Dex 13, Con 15, Int 10, Wis 12, Cha 8
Monster.Feats: Dodge, Two-Weapon Fighting, Weapon Focus (handaxe)
Monster.Skills: Climb +7, Intimidate +4, Knowledge (geography) +5, Knowledge (nature) +5, Perception +6, Stealth +5, Survival +6
Monster.SQ: track +1, wild empathy +1
Monster.DuringCombat: Kressle spends the first few rounds of combat throwing daggers and waiting for the enemy to fight their way through her bandits to confront her. She'll switch to using her two axes after a few rounds, focusing her attacks on humans if she can.
Monster.Morale: Kressle attempts to flee south to the Stag Lord's fort if brought below 5 hit points, but if it's obvious that she can't escape the PCs, she fights to the death.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure light wounds
Monster.OtherGear: studded leather armor, 2 masterwork handaxes, 4 daggers, 85 gp

Monster.Name: Giant Whiptail Centipede
Monster.Melee: bite +4 (2d6+7 plus poison), tail slap -1 (1d3 nonlethal plus trip)
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 25, Dex 11, Con 21, Int -, Wis 10, Cha 2
Monster.Skills: Climb +15
Monster.SQ: compact
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Compact (Ex) Although a giant whiptail centipede is a Huge creature, its compact and slender frame allow it to squeeze through areas as if it were a Medium creature–it still suffers normal effects for squeezing into small areas. Poison (Ex) Bite–injury; save Fort DC 14; frequency 1/round for 6 rounds; effect 1d4 Dex; cure 1 save. Tail Slap (Ex) A whiptail centipede's tail slap attack inflicts nonlethal damage and gains no bonus from its strength score on damage inflicted. The monster's reach with its tail slap is 20 feet.
Monster.DuringCombat: The whiptail attacks the closest target, pursuing it throughout the mite lair but not out of it. These stats have been modified for the fact that the centipede is forced to squeeze in the environs.
Monster.Morale: The centipede fights to the death.

Monster.Name: Tickleback
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 18, Dex 10, Con 19, Int -, Wis 10, Cha 2
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Blood Drain (Ex) A tunnel tick drains blood at the end of each turn it grapples a target, inflicting 1 point of Strength and Constitution damage. Disease (Ex) Red ache: Bite–injury; save Fort DC 16; onset 1d3 days; frequency 1 day; effect 1d6 Str damage; cure 2 consecutive saves. The save DC is Constitution-based.
Monster.DuringCombat: The tunnel tick attacks the target Grabbles directs, or the closest large target if no orders are given.
Monster.Morale: The tunnel tick fights to the death.

Monster.Name: Chief Sootscale
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 10, Dex 17, Con 10, Int 8, Wis 10, Cha 13
Monster.Feats: Dodge, Improved Initiative
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +9, Climb +5, Disable Device +9, Intimidate +7, Linguistics +3, Perception +6, Stealth +13, Swim +6
Monster.SQ: crafty, rogue talent (surprise attack), trapfinding
Monster.DuringCombat: Chief Sootscale moves in quickly to attack obvious healers on the first round of combat, hoping to get in a sneak attack. He then uses Acrobatics to stay mobile and attack foes who are flanked.
Monster.Morale: Chief Sootscale surrenders if brought below 5 hit points, dropping his club and trying to blame Tartuk for "forcing" him to attack the PCs. Sootscale hopes to get the PCs to shift their wrath to the other kobold with this tactic.
Monster.Gear: masterwork club, amulet of natural armor +1

Monster.Name: Tartuk
Monster.SpellsKnown: Spells Known (CL 5th; concentration +9) 2nd (5/day)-detect thoughts (DC 16), invisibility, minor image (DC 16) 1st (7/day)-cause fear (DC 15), identify, shield, silent image (DC 15), unseen servant 0 (at will)-acid splash, detect magic, light, mage hand, message, prestidigitation
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 8, Dex 12, Con 11, Int 14, Wis 8, Cha 18
Monster.Feats: Alertness, Arcane Strike, Eschew Materials, Improved Initiative, Silent Spell
Monster.Skills: Appraise +5, Bluff +12, Fly +0, Knowledge (arcana) +7, Knowledge (geography) +3, Knowledge (religion) +4, Perception +1, Sense Motive +1, Spellcraft +10, Stealth +0, Survival +4
Monster.SQ: arcane bond (raven familiar named Tickbiter), bloodline arcana, crafty, metamagic adept 1/day
Monster.BeforeCombat: Tartuk casts shield as soon as he knows he'll be meeting with the PCs or hears the commotion of approaching kobolds. He casts unseen servant every day as well.
Monster.DuringCombat: Tartuk uses his wand and cause fear against enemies unless forced into melee, in which case he uses Arcane Strike to increase damage done with his sickle (this damage bonus is included in the stats above).
Monster.Morale: Tartuk fights to the death, almost as if on some level he seeks it.
Monster.Gear: wand of magic missile (CL 3rd, 28 charges)
Monster.OtherGear: masterwork cold iron sickle, bracers of armor +1, personal journal (see Treasure below)
Monster.BaseStatistics: Without shield and Arcane Strike, Tartuk's stats are: AC 14, flat-footed 13; Melee mwk cold iron sickle +3 (1d4–1)

Monster.Name: Auchs
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 20, Dex 11, Con 14, Int 3, Wis 13, Cha 4
Monster.Feats: Fleet, Great Fortitude, Skill Focus (Perception), Toughness, Weapon Focus (club)
Monster.Skills: Perception +7, Swim +11
Monster.SQ: armor training 1
Monster.DuringCombat: Auchs is singularly unimaginative in battle, roaring wordlessly and wielding his club in both hands.
Monster.Morale: Auchs fights to the death if Dovan is visible, but otherwise surrenders and begs for his life if brought below 5 hp. If granted mercy, Auchs becomes the loyal companion of whoever "saved him," but his natural tendency toward cruelty might make for later problems.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure moderate wounds (2), potion of lesser restoration
Monster.OtherGear: leather armor, club, knight and dragon toys worth 45 gp in all, silver Stag Lord amulet worth 20 gp

Monster.Name: Dovan from Nisroch
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 14, Dex 17, Con 12, Int 10, Wis 8, Cha 13
Monster.Feats: Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Mobility, Weapon Finesse
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +9, Bluff +7, Diplomacy +7, Escape Artist +9, Intimidate +7, Knowledge (local) +6, Perception +5, Sleight of Hand +9, Stealth +9
Monster.SQ: rogue talents (finesse rogue), trapfinding
Monster.DuringCombat: If the PCs attack the guards in the yard, Dovan watches for a round or two to judge how tough these intruders are. As soon as the PCs drop a bandit, Dovan releases the gate to the owlbear's cage and then flees into area Z1, luring the owlbear out into the open before he dodges into area Z9 to climb up to area Z2a, leaving the owlbear distracted by the easier-to-reach PCs. If forced into a fight, Dovan attempts to flank opponents, using Mobility to dance out of reach of immediate reprisals.
Monster.Morale: Dovan attempts to flee into the wilds if reduced to fewer than 4 hit points, but if cornered, he fights to the death.
Monster.Gear: masterwork studded leather, +1 rapier, daggers (3), silver Stag Lord amulet worth 20 gp, turquoise earrings worth 130 gp each, 28 gp, 2 pp

Monster.Name: Akiros Ismort
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 18, Dex 12, Con 20, Int 10, Wis 8, Cha 15
Monster.Feats: Iron Will, Quick Draw, Weapon Focus (longsword)
Monster.Skills: Intimidate +9, Knowledge (religion) +5, Perception +6, Survival +6, Swim +5
Monster.DuringCombat: Akiros fights with the ferocity of one who doesn't care if he lives or dies; he rages on the first round of combat, and focuses his attacks first on healers, then other spellcasters, and finally on non-spellcasters.
Monster.Morale: Akiros fights to the death.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure light wounds (2)
Monster.OtherGear: masterwork chainmail, heavy steel shield, +1 longsword, composite longbow (+2 Str) with 20 arrows and 3 +1 magical beast bane arrows, silver holy symbol of Erastil, silver Stag Lord amulet worth 20 gp, 80 gp
Monster.BaseStatistics: AC 19, touch 11, flat-footed 18; hp 39; Fort +8, Will +4; Melee +1 longsword +8 (1d8+3/19–20); Str 14, Con 16

Monster.Name: The Stag Lord
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 14, Dex 18, Con 14, Int 10, Wis 8, Cha 12
Monster.Feats: Deadly Aim, Diehard, Dodge, Endurance, Iron Will, Point Blank Shot, Precise Shot, Toughness, Weapon Focus (composite longbow)
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +13, Appraise +9, Climb +11, Intimidate +10, Knowledge (geography) +3, Perception +10, Stealth +13, Survival +8, Swim +11
Monster.SQ: favored terrain (hills +2), rogue talents (combat trick, weapon training), track +1, trapfinding, wild empathy +4
Monster.BeforeCombat: The Stag Lord is in a perpetual state of hangover or drunkenness, and as a result he is sickened–his stats have been adjusted to reflect this (and as a result, his CR is 1 lower than normal). If he sobers up, these stats effectively gain a +2 bonus on attack rolls, weapon damage rolls, saving throws, skill checks, and ability checks.
Monster.DuringCombat: When attacking with his bow, the Stag Lord usually employs his Deadly Aim feat (included in his stats). He prefers to fight with his bow if possible, favoring attacks on foes who are flat-footed, using the insightful shot ability of his stag's helm or taking time to move into hiding and use Stealth to set up new shots so that he can make sneak attacks. In melee, he shifts and moves to flank foes if possible. Humans are his favorite targets, for in many of them he sees the face of his father. He drinks potions to heal damage if reduced below 20 hit points.
Monster.Morale: The Stag Lord fights to the death.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure moderate wounds (2)
Monster.OtherGear: +1 leather armor, masterwork longsword, +1 composite longbow (+2 Str) with 20 arrows, amulet of natural armor +1, stag's helm

Monster.Name: Jona Clay
Monster.SpecialAttacks: bardic performance 6 rounds/day (countersong, distraction, fascinate, inspire courage +1), sneak attack +2d6
Monster.SpellsKnown: Bard Spells Known (CL 1st; concentration +3) 1st (2/day)-charm person (DC 13), cure light wounds 0 (at will)-dancing lights, mage hand, message, prestidigitation
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 10, Dex 14, Con 10, Int 14, Wis 12, Cha 15
Monster.Feats: Combat Expertise, Dodge, Endurance, Improved Feint, Improved Iron Will, Improved Trip, Persuasive, Quick Draw
Monster.Skills: Bluff +6, Diplomacy +14, Disable Device +9, Intimidate +4, Knowledge (dungeoneering) +8, Knowledge (geography) +7, Knowledge (history) +8, Knowledge (local) +13, Knowledge (nature) +13, Linguistics +11, Perception +11, Perform (oratory) +12, Profession (scribe) +9, Sense Motive +11, Stealth +12, Survival +6
Monster.Languages: Ancient Osiriani, Celestial, Common, Dwarven, Elven, Gnome, Goblin, Orc, Skald
Monster.SQ: bardic knowledge +1, favored enemy (undead +2), favored terrain (urban +2), rogue talent (combat rogue), track +1, trapfinding +1, wild empathy +5
Monster.BeforeCombat: Jona does everything in his power to avoid combat through diplomacy and compromise.
Monster.DuringCombat: Jona relies on Combat Expertise and attempts to inflict only nonlethal damage. The entire time, he constantly tries to defuse the conflict by looking for compromises or means to get his enemies to back down.
Monster.Morale: Jona is willing to die to protect his friends and family, but he won't die cheaply. He's quick to flee a pointless death and is insightful enough to warn friends and neighbors so they can't be used as leverage against him.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure moderate wounds, tanglefoot bags (4)
Monster.OtherGear: +1 studded leather, +1 quarterstaff, sap, ring of protection +1, masterwork thieves' tools, 225 gp

Monster.Name: Ries Cuprianas
Monster.SpecialAttacks: favored enemy (humans +4, evil outsiders +2), favored terrain (plains +2)
Monster.SpellsPrepared: Spells Prepared (CL 3rd; concentration +6) 1st-hide from animals, pass without trace (DC 14)
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 10, Dex 15, Con 12, Int 13, Wis 17, Cha 8
Monster.Feats: Endurance, Far Shot, Improved Lightning Reflexes, Lightning Reflexes, Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot, Weapon Focus (longbow)
Monster.Skills: Climb +6, Heal +12, Knowledge (geography) +10, Knowledge (nature) +10, Perception +12, Ride +8, Stealth +8, Survival +12, Swim +6
Monster.SQ: hunter's bond (companions), track +3, wild empathy +5
Monster.BeforeCombat: When escorting refugees, Ries avoids combat whenever possible. If a fight is inevitable, he casts pass without trace on the people he's helping to allow them to escape.
Monster.DuringCombat: Ries ambushes from cover whenever possible, engaging in hit-and-run tactics to delay the enemy, preferring to stay at range near cover.
Monster.Morale: Ries retreats as soon as those under his protection or command are safe.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure moderate wounds, potion of invisibility
Monster.OtherGear: masterwork breastplate, +1 longbow with 20 arrows, dagger, longsword, cloak of resistance +1, 308 gp

Monster.Name: Krun Thuul
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 18, Dex 10, Con 8, Int 14, Wis 10, Cha 12
Monster.Feats: Combat Expertise, Critical Focus, Dodge, Improved Critical (guisarme), Improved Trip, Intimidating Prowess, Leadership, Persuasive, Power Attack, Run, Toughness
Monster.Skills: Diplomacy +11, Intimidate +22, Knowledge (history) +8, Knowledge (local) +8, Perception +8, Ride +5, Survival +10
Monster.SQ: armor training 2, weapon familiarity
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Leadership Krun Thuul's leadership score is 12. His cohort is an 8th-level orc cleric. His most loyal followers include 2 orc berserkers (page 36), 2 orc shamans (page 36), and 4 orc skolls (page 36). The rest of his horde consists of 50 mercenary orc warriors (see Pathfinder RPG Bestiary 222.)
Monster.BeforeCombat: When Krun is about to enter battle, he uses Intimidate to shake up his foes and orders his followers into a battle line. Typically, he brings an orc cleric onto the battlefield as his cohort to cast spells that improve his fighting ability, such as bless.
Monster.DuringCombat: Krun uses reach to his advantage. He shifts about the battlefield, relying on his minions to block opponents while he steps into areas that will allow his reach to strike enemies with impunity. If an enemy closes past his reach, he batters the opponent with armor spikes but steps away as soon as an opening is available. He uses Improved Trip with his guisarme to knock down advancing opponents and then makes attacks of opportunity when they stand up within his reach.
Monster.Morale: If confronted by a clearly superior opponent, or one that he can't easily harm, he runs away. He also flees if an opponent reduces him to 20 hit points or fewer or a single attack deals him 20 or more points of damage. Thanks to his armor training and his Run feat, Krun can usually outrun his opponents. He sacrifices his own troops to achieve a significant victory or save his own life.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure moderate wounds
Monster.OtherGear: +1 full plate with +1 spikes, +1 guisarme, javelins (4), amulet of natural armor +1, cloak of resistance +1, ring of protection +1, 200 gp

Monster.Name: Brinian
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 14, Dex 18, Con 12, Int 10, Wis 8, Cha 13
Monster.Feats: Agile Maneuvers, Alertness, Disruptive, Exotic Weapon Proficiency (Aldori dueling sword), Improved Disarm, Weapon Finesse, Weapon Focus (Aldori dueling sword), Weapon Specialization (Aldori dueling sword)
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +6, Climb +7, Intimidate +10, Perception +4, Ride +6, Sense Motive +7
Monster.SQ: armor training 1
Monster.BeforeCombat: Brinian ordinarily calls out his opponent to set up a fair fight, preferring to duel until first blood is drawn, though he is willing to duel until one participant lands three hits. He only ambushes opponents in dire circumstances or if he can be convinced that the indignity is absolutely necessary.
Monster.DuringCombat: Outside of a duel, Brinian enjoys closing with spellcasters to make use of his Disruptive feat. Otherwise he attacks the most powerful melee opponent and attempts to shame his enemies into fighting him one-on-one, using vulgar comments, slights against his foe's appearance, skill, favorite foods, liaisons with sisters and mothers, and anything else he can determine about his opponent.
Monster.Morale: Brinian's air of bravado is quite sincere and doesn't crack until he reaches 5 hit points or fewer, at which point he flees. If humbled in this fashion, he remembers the face of the one responsible and plots revenge.
Monster.Gear: elixir of tumbling (2), potions of cure light wounds (6)
Monster.OtherGear: masterwork breastplate, masterwork Aldori dueling sword, light crossbow with 10 bolts, dagger, amulet of natural armor +1, cloak of resistance +1, 142 gp

Monster.Name: Menthen Jagaro
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 8, Dex 9, Con 10, Int 15, Wis 12, Cha 12
Monster.Feats: Persuasive, Skill Focus (Appraise), Skill Focus (Sense Motive)
Monster.Skills: Appraise +14, Bluff +10, Diplomacy +12, Intimidate +12, Knowledge (geography) +11, Knowledge (history) +9, Knowledge (local) +11, Knowledge (religion) +11, Profession (merchant) +10, Ride +4, Sense Motive +13
Monster.DuringCombat: Menthen avoids combat by hiding behind his bodyguards. If threatened directly, he tries to bribe his attacker or spill coins as a distraction so he can escape.
Monster.Morale: Menthen wants to die old and in bed and does whatever he can to avoid being murdered.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure moderate wounds
Monster.OtherGear: dagger, 3,150 gp (most of this money is tied up in investments; he usually carries no more than 100 gp on him)

Monster.Name: Vaylen Goldfield
Monster.Saves: Fort +2, Ref +7, Will +6; +4 vs. bardic performance, language-dependent, and sonic
Monster.Save_Mods: +4 vs. bardic performance, language-dependent, and sonic
Monster.SpecialAttacks: bardic performance 13 rounds/day (countersong, distraction, fascinate, inspire competence +2, inspire courage +1)
Monster.SpellsKnown: Spells Known (CL 4th; concentration +7) 2nd (2/day)-alter self, invisibility 1st (4/day)-charm person (DC 14), cure light wounds, undetectable alignment (DC 14), ventriloquism 0 (at will)-daze (DC 13), detect magic, know direction, mage hand, message, read magic
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 8, Dex 16, Con 12, Int 13, Wis 10, Cha 16
Monster.Feats: Arcane Strike, Mounted Combat, Point-Blank Shot, Rapid Reload
Monster.Skills: Bluff +9, Craft (calligraphy) +5, Diplomacy +9, Disguise +11, Intimidate +11, Knowledge (history) +8, Knowledge (local) +7, Knowledge (nobility) +9, Perception +8, Perform (sing) +11, Profession (herbalist) +4, Ride +7, Sense Motive +6, Sleight of Hand +7, Spellcraft +5, Use Magic Device +7
Monster.SQ: bardic knowledge +2, versatile performance (sing), well-versed
Monster.BeforeCombat: Valyen sends minions into combat first. He casts invisibility on himself, drinks his potion of eagle's splendor, and moves to a tactically and defensively superior position.
Monster.DuringCombat: Vaylen casts summon monster I to conjure a fiendish viper and targets melee-focused opponents with charm person. He then tries to use fascinate and attacks with his crossbow.
Monster.Morale: Vaylen fights to the death, knowing that his fanatical followers will stop at nothing to resurrect him.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure moderate wounds, potion of eagle's splendor, scroll of animate rope, scroll of summon monster I
Monster.OtherGear: masterwork chain shirt, masterwork heavy crossbow with 20 bolts, masterwork dagger, ring of protection +1, light combattrained horse with riding saddle, wooden mask, 360 gp

Monster.Name: Jherek Oivos
Monster.SpecialAttacks: sneak attack +2d6, hand of the apprentice (5/day)
Monster.SpellsPrepared: Spells Prepared (CL 2nd; concentration +4) 1st-charm person (DC 13), magic missile 0 (at will)-detect magic, message, prestidigitation, read magic
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 12, Dex 18, Con 10, Int 14, Wis 14, Cha 12
Monster.Feats: Alertness, Dodge, Scribe Scroll, Spring Attack, Weapon Finesse, Weapon Focus (rapier)
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +13, Bluff +10, Climb +5, Diplomacy +10, Disable Device +10, Disguise +10, Escape Artist +10, Knowledge (arcana) +7, Knowledge (history) +7, Knowledge (local) +7, Perception +13, Sense Motive +9, Stealth +13
Monster.SQ: arcane bond (cat named Shingles), native Hermean, rogue talents (fast stealth, finesse rogue), trapfinding +2
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Native Hermean (Ex) Generations of selective breeding have given natives of the island of Hermea numerous beneficial traits, making them shining examples of their races. A native Hermean PC uses the purchase method to determine ability scores and the high fantasy point allotment (see Pathfinder RPG Core Rulebook 15).
Monster.BeforeCombat: Jherek rejects the idea of a fair fight, and if he can't talk his way out of combat using Diplomacy or charm person, he attempts to hide in order to surprise his opponents with a sneak attack.
Monster.DuringCombat: Though he enjoys a friendly duel as much as the next person, Jherek takes his mission too seriously to risk himself needlessly and uses spring attack to stay out of reach, sneak attacking surprised or flanked foes. Against nongood foes, his natural prejudice shows through, and he has no qualms about using lethal force against "inferior specimens."
Monster.Morale: Jherek retreats if brought below 10 hit points, preferring to ambush his prey later.
Monster.Gear: potions of cure light wounds (3)
Monster.OtherGear: masterwork hand crossbow with 20 bolts, masterwork rapier, daggers (2), ring of protection +1, backpack, blank invitations (3), masterwork thieves' tools, pen and ink (1 vial), silk rope (50 ft.), spellbook, 450 gp

Monster.Name: Galenna Icethorne
Monster.SpellLikeAbilities: Bloodline Spell-Like Abilities (CL 6th; concentration +9) 6/day-touch of destiny (+3)
Monster.SpellsKnown: Spells Known (CL 6th; concentration +9) 3rd (3/day)-sleet storm 2nd (5/day)-blur, invisibility, detect thoughts (DC 15) 1st (6/day)-alarm, charm person (DC 14), chill touch (DC 14), color spray (DC 14), comprehend languages 0 (at will)-arcane mark, detect magic, detect poison, flare (DC 13), light, message, ray of frost
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 10, Dex 8, Con 12, Int 14, Wis 14, Cha 17
Monster.Feats: Alertness, Combat Casting, Endurance, Eschew Materials, Silent Spell
Monster.Skills: Diplomacy +9, Knowledge (geography) +6, Knowledge (history) +8, Knowledge (local) +6, Linguistics +3, Perception +7, Sense Motive +10, Spellcraft +11, Survival +5
Monster.SQ: bloodline arcana
Monster.BeforeCombat: If Galenna is near a civilized area, she presses others into service to assist her in an upcoming battle. No town can deny her access to whatever guard they have, and she has been known to demand that even farmers fight for her. Galenna casts invisibility and enters combat with chill touch when she deems the moment right.
Monster.DuringCombat: Galenna recognizes fellow spellcasters and attempts to disable them first with her offensive spells and her wand of magic missile. She then casts sleet storm to catch the largest number of enemies in its area, even if this means damaging her allies.
Monster.Morale: Galenna is unafraid of death, knowing that her sisters will eventually recover her body and restore her to life, but she prefers to avoid being killed if it is within her power to do so. If things go poorly in a battle, she uses her potion of gaseous form to escape.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure moderate wounds, potion of gaseous form, scroll of dispel magic, scroll of obscuring mist, scroll of tiny hut, wand of magic missile (CL 3rd, 30 charges)
Monster.OtherGear: bracers of armor +1, masterwork dagger, 173 gp

Monster.Name: Fadil ibn-Kazar
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 8, Dex 16, Con 10, Int 16, Wis 12, Cha 13
Monster.Feats: Deceitful, Improved Initiative, Persuasive, Weapon Finesse
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +10, Appraise +10, Bluff +10, Diplomacy +10, Disable Device +10, Disguise +10, Intimidate +7, Knowledge (geography) +5, Knowledge (history) +5, Knowledge (local) +10, Linguistics +10, Perception +8, Sense Motive +8, Sleight of Hand +10, Stealth +9
Monster.Languages: Common, Elven, Gnoll, Gnome, Halfling, Kelish, Osiriani, Varisian
Monster.SQ: rogue talents (finesse rogue, slow reactions), trapfinding +2
Monster.BeforeCombat: Fadil prefers to avoid combat whenever possible. If he cannot escape in disguise, he attempts to use his slow reactions ability and flee. He tries diplomacy first if he has even a few seconds to try to talk his opponents out of killing him.
Monster.DuringCombat: If forced to fight, Fadil tries to feint the opponent who looks physically strongest and then disable him with a sneak attack. Fadil knows he cannot take many direct hits, so he fights defensively whenever attacking.
Monster.Morale: Fadil runs at the first opportunity unless it means abandoning his product. He tries his best to negotiate if his pesh is on the line, fleeing only if it becomes apparent that to stay would mean death. He is willing to offer some of his product, information, or services in exchange for his hide.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure light wounds
Monster.OtherGear: +1 leather armor, masterwork light crossbow with 20 bolts, masterwork dagger, pieces of various disguises, 560 gp (mostly in the form of pesh, if it is legal to carry)

Monster.Name: Vendlara Alderane
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 14, Dex 17, Con 10, Int 11, Wis 10, Cha 14
Monster.Feats: Dodge, Endurance, Persuasive, Point-Blank Shot
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +6, Bluff +5, Climb +6, Diplomacy +4, Intimidate +8, Knowledge (nature) +6, Perception +8, Stealth +8, Survival +6, Swim +8
Monster.SQ: elven magic, favored terrain (forest +2), hunter's bond (companions), track +2, weapon familiarity, wild empathy +6
Monster.BeforeCombat: Vendlara likes to ambush enemies.
Monster.DuringCombat: Vendlara prefers to fight from a distance, and from a secure tree branch if possible. She uses her tanglefoot bags against winged or fast opponents to slow them down and prevent pursuit or escape. If her allies are not practiced demon hunters, she uses her hunter's bond ability.
Monster.Morale: Vendlara flees if her arrows seem ineffectual, using tanglefoot bags to help her escape.
Monster.Gear: tanglefoot bags (4)
Monster.OtherGear: +1 chain shirt, masterwork longsword, masterwork composite longbow (+2 Str) with 20 arrows, 215 gp

Monster.Name: Modoru Redgrave
Monster.SpecialAttacks: channel positive energy (DC 13, 2d6), smite evil 2/day (+1 attack and AC, +4 damage)
Monster.SpellLikeAbilities: Spell-Like Abilities (CL 4th; concentration +5) At will-detect evil
Monster.SpellsPrepared: Spells Prepared (CL 1st; concentration +2) 1st-lesser restoration
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 16, Dex 10, Con 14, Int 10, Wis 13, Cha 12
Monster.Feats: Animal Affinity, Extra Lay on Hands, Mounted Combat, Trample
Monster.Skills: Diplomacy +6, Handle Animal +9, Heal +8, Perception +6, Ride +5, Sense Motive +5
Monster.SQ: aura of good, lay on hands (2d6, 5/day), mercy (shaken)
Monster.BeforeCombat: Modoru does not use his shield in mounted combat but does keep it on his horse in case he needs to enter single combat.
Monster.DuringCombat: Modoru attempts to use his warhorse, Ironring, as his primary weapon in combat. He leads with an overrun attack to soften opponents before wheeling around to finish them off. He is willing to dismount but attempts to fight from horseback for as long as is feasible.
Monster.Morale: Modoru knows the value of a tactical retreat, but he never leaves combat due to personal injury, only for the good of those around him.
Monster.Gear: holy water (4)
Monster.OtherGear: masterwork full plate, masterwork heavy steel shield, masterwork composite longbow (+2 Str) with 20 arrows, masterwork longsword, healer's kit, combat trained heavy horse (Ironring), sunrods (2), 263 gp
Monster.BaseStatistics: When using his shield, Modoru's statistics are: Melee mwk longsword +8 (1d8+3/19–20); AC 21, touch 20, flat-footed 21 (+9 armor, +2 shield); Skills Ride +4

Monster.Name: Bjorn Grimsong
Monster.SpecialAttacks: rage (10 rounds/day), rage power (superstition +2), weapon training (axes +1)
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 18, Dex 12, Con 22, Int 8, Wis 10, Cha 14
Monster.Feats: Dazzling Display, Disruptive, Improved Sunder, Iron Will, Power Attack, Step Up, Toughness, Weapon Focus (battleaxe), Weapon Specialization (battleaxe)
Monster.Skills: Climb +10, Heal +2, Knowledge (geography) +1, Knowledge (nature) +3, Perception +9, Survival +8, Swim +8
Monster.SQ: armor training 1, fast movement
Monster.BeforeCombat: If Bjorn has a chance to show off his prowess before the fight starts, he uses his Dazzling Display feat to cow enemies. His relative inexperience with battle magic means that he avoids reliance on spellcasters, though he is willing to accept beneficial spells if the opportunity presents itself. If he expects to be outnumbered or fighting a powerful opponent, he drinks his potion of bull's strength in preparation for battle.
Monster.DuringCombat: Wielding the prince's axe, Bjorn relies on his rage and Power Attack feat to maximize damage. He likes to sunder enemy weapons, and uses his Step Up and Disruptive feats to press the attack against lightly armored enemies and spellcasters.
Monster.Morale: Bjorn believes that he has a destiny to fulfill. As such, he does not waste his time with fights that do not serve his cause, nor with battles he cannot win. If Bjorn is reduced to 20 or fewer hit points, he retreats. He also retreats from an obviously superior foe. If he is convinced that he is working toward the destruction of the sorcerer, he is implacable and will seek any advantage.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure moderate wounds, potion of bull's strength
Monster.OtherGear: +1 breastplate, +1 heavy wooden shield, +1 battleaxe, masterwork short bow with 20 arrows, ring of protection +1, 363 gp
Monster.BaseStatistics: When not raging, Bjorn's stats are: AC 22, touch 12, flat-footed 21; hp 86; Fort +12, Will +4; Melee +1 battleaxe +13/+8 (1d8+6/x3); Str 14, Con 18; CMB +10; Skills Climb +8, Swim +6

Monster.Name: Thaim
Monster.Ranged: mwk shortspear +5 (1d6+2) or mwk sling +5 (1d4+2) or javelin +4 (1d6+2)
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 14, Dex 13, Con 17, Int 8, Wis 10, Cha 12
Monster.Feats: Animal Affinity, Endurance, Far Shot, Mounted Combat, Point-Blank Shot, Trample
Monster.Skills: Climb +4, Handle Animal +9, Heal +4, Knowledge (nature) +5, Perception +6, Perform (Dance) +2, Ride +7, Stealth +5, Survival +6
Monster.SQ: favored terrain (plains +2), track +1, wild empathy +4
Monster.BeforeCombat: Thaim thinks like a hunter and tries to arrange the conditions of the battle as if he were hunting an animal, mainly by relying on surprise.
Monster.DuringCombat: Thaim prefers to fight while riding his mammoth. If he must fight on the ground, he uses his longspear, or shortspear and shield if his enemy is particularly dangerous (AC 17, touch 11, flat-footed 16 [+4 armor, +1 Dex, +2 shield]).
Monster.Morale: Although Thaim is not terribly bright, he understands that his mission to save his tribe will fail if he dies. If brought to 10 hit points or fewer, he flees, directing his mammoth to clear a path if possible.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure light wounds (3)
Monster.OtherGear: masterwork hide armor, masterwork heavy wooden shield, javelins (3), masterwork longspear, masterwork shortspear, masterwork sling with 20 stones, medicine bag, pet mammoth (see below)

Monster.Name: Illian Glanadrian
Monster.Saves: Fort +2, Ref +10, Will +8; +1 vs. poison; +2 vs. enchantments; +4 vs. bardic performance, language-dependent, and sonic
Monster.Save_Mods: +1 vs. poison+2 vs. enchantments; +4 vs. bardic performance, language-dependent, and sonic
Monster.Melee: violin bow (improvised) +7 (1d3-1) or +1 dagger +8 (1d4/19-20 plus poison)
Monster.SpecialAttacks: bardic performance 15 rounds/day (countersong, distraction, fascinate [DC 16], inspire competence +2, inspire courage +2), death attack (DC 15), sneak attack +2d6
Monster.SpellsKnown: Spells Known (CL 5th; concentration +8) 2nd (3/day)-eagle's splendor, hold person (DC 15), silence (DC 15) 1st (5/day)-disguise self, expeditious retreat, sleep (DC 15), undetectable alignment 0 (at will)-detect magic, lullaby (DC 14), mage hand, open/ close, prestidigitation, read magic
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 8, Dex 16, Con 8, Int 14, Wis 14, Cha 16
Monster.Feats: Catch Off-Guard, Quick Draw, Run, Weapon Finesse
Monster.Skills: Disguise +11, Intimidate +11, Knowledge (local) +12, Perception +15, Perform (act) +14, Perform (string instruments) +14, Sense Motive +13, Sleight of Hand +14, Stealth +14
Monster.SQ: bardic knowledge +2, elven magic, lore master 1/day, poison use, versatile performance (string instruments), weapon familiarity
Monster.BeforeCombat: Illian avoids actual combat if at all possible, fleeing confrontations that do not happen on her terms. When she is about to commit murder, she casts eagle's splendor, poisons her daggers, uses fascinate, and finishes with a death attack.
Monster.DuringCombat: Illian uses hold person, sleep, or her Catch Off-Guard feat to make sneak attacks. She uses silence to prevent her foes from calling for aid, and Bluff and Diplomacy skills if guards respond to the noise.
Monster.Morale: If Illian is outnumbered or a victim does not succumb to her bardic abilities, she flees immediately.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure moderate wounds, potions of invisibility (2)
Monster.OtherGear: +1 mithral chain shirt, +1 dagger, daggers (2), cloak of resistance +1, jewelry worth 300 gp, large scorpion venom (5), masterwork violin, 350 gp

Monster.Name: Ntanga
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 15, Dex 16, Con 14, Int 13, Wis 12, Cha 8
Monster.Feats: Dodge, Great Fortitude, Mobility, Skill Focus (Perception), Weapon Focus (slam)
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +7, Bluff +9, Climb +16, Disable Device +12, Disguise +3, Escape Artist +12, Knowledge (history) +2, Knowledge (nobility) +2, Knowledge (religion) +2, Linguistics +6, Perception +12, Perform (dance) +3, Sense Motive +9, Sleight of Hand +9, Stealth +11, Swim +6
Monster.SQ: rogue talent (combat trick, ledge walker), trapfinding +2
Monster.BeforeCombat: Ntanga pretends to be a simple animal so potential enemies do not consider him a significant threat.
Monster.DuringCombat: If Kingstone is present, Ntanga pretends to wait until his "master" orders him to fight. He makes use of his climbing and Mobility to find an advantageous position in a battle, using his necklace of fireballs if facing many foes or if he needs to end combat quickly to maintain his cover.
Monster.Morale: If Ntanga is brought to 10 hit points or fewer, his behavior depends on what his opponents know. If they believe him to be just an animal, he flees or prostrates himself before them. If they know he is intelligent, he flees or tries to bargain for his life.
Monster.Gear: necklace of fireballs (type I; two 3d6 beads remaining)
Monster.OtherGear: +1 studded leather, chain collar and leash, masterwork thieves' tools, 475 gp

Monster.Name: Satha
Monster.SpellLikeAbilities: Arcane Spell-Like Abilities (CL 9th, concentration +13) At will-elemental wall (12 rounds/day) 7/day-force missile
Monster.SpellsPrepared: Spells Prepared (CL 9th; concentration +13) 5th-cone of cold (DC 21), elemental body II 4th-fire shield, shout (DC 20), wall of fire (DC 20) 3rd-fireball (DC 19), fly, halt undead (DC 17), lightning bolt (DC 19), vampiric touch 2nd-bear's endurance, command undead (DC 16), darkvision, false life, flaming sphere (DC 18), rope trick 1st-burning hands (2, DC 17), floating disk, magic missile (2), shield 0 (at will)-detect magic, disrupt undead, light, mage hand, read magic
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 8, Dex 13, Con 14, Int 19, Wis 10, Cha 12
Monster.Feats: Arcane Strike, Brew Potion, Combat Casting, Greater Spell Focus (evocation), Improved Initiative, Scribe Scroll, Spell Focus (evocation), Toughness
Monster.Skills: Appraise +12, Craft (alchemy) +14, Fly +11, Intimidate +2, Knowledge (arcana) +16, Knowledge (geography) +9, Knowledge (religion) +11, Linguistics +8, Perception +9, Profession (scribe) +4, Ride +2, Sense Motive +7, Spellcraft +16, Use Magic Device +10
Monster.Languages: Common, Draconic, Gnome, Kelish, Osiriani, Vudrani
Monster.SQ: arcane bond (ring of protection)
Monster.BeforeCombat: Satha casts false life on himself every day. Given warning about the nature of his opponents, Satha drinks potions of protection from energy and resist energy. If he expects flying enemies or needs to maneuver quickly, he casts fly. If he anticipates the need to flee, he casts rope trick in a hidden place to give him a place to retreat to.
Monster.DuringCombat: Satha tries to deal as much damage as possible at the start of combat in order to kill as many weak opponents as he can. Depending on the nature of his opponents, he may cast fire shield or shield, or use a defensive scroll. If battling undead, he either tries to kill them with brute force or disables the leader with command undead or halt undead to give himself time to destroy enemy minions. He likes to use his elemental wall ability to divide the battlefield to his advantage.
Monster.Morale: Satha has died once and doesn't want to experience that again; if brought to 20 hit points or fewer, he flees, using elemental wall, expeditious retreat, fly, invisibility, or rope trick as needed.
Monster.Gear: potions of bear's endurance, cure moderate wounds, cure serious wounds, darkvision, invisibility, protection from arrows, protection from energy (fire), resist energy (cold), resist energy (fire), and water breathing; scrolls of alter self, cone of cold, and expeditious retreat
Monster.OtherGear: amulet of natural armor +1, bracers of armor +1, cloak of resistance +1, ring of protection +1, 610 gp

Monster.Name: Alviana Shadowsworn
Monster.SpellsPrepared: Spells Prepared (CL 6th; concentration +10) 3rd-call lightning (DC 17), invisibility, poison (DC 17) 2nd-barkskin, chill touch (DC 16), gust of wind (DC 16), summon swarm 1st-cure light wounds, entangle (DC 15), magic stone, touch of fatigue (DC 15) 0 (at will)-detect magic, disrupt undead, guidance, ray of frost
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 8, Dex 12, Con 10, Int 14, Wis 18, Cha 13
Monster.Feats: Alertness, Augment Summoning, Natural Spell, Shade of the Uskwood (see below)
Monster.Skills: Bluff +3, Diplomacy +4, Disguise +3, Fly +5, Handle Animal +10, Heal +10, Knowledge (arcana) +3, Knowledge (dungeoneering) +3, Knowledge (geography) +6, Knowledge (history) +4, Knowledge (local) +3, Knowledge (nature) +11, Knowledge (nobility) +3, Knowledge (religion) +5, Perception +13, Sense Motive +8, Stealth +1, Survival +15, Swim +1
Monster.SQ: nature bond (owl companion named Sootsable), nature sense, trackless step, wild empathy +7, woodland stride
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Feats Alviana's Shade of the Uskwood feat is only available to a sect of albino druids from Nidal allied with the church of Zon-Kuthon; this feat adds unusual spells to the druid's spell list, removes all fire spells from it, and requires an Umbrae-Token (an effigy made of hair, twigs, and blood that counts as an unholy symbol). See page 111 of the Pathfinder Chronicles Campaign Setting.
Monster.BeforeCombat: Alviana summons animals (preferring bats and snakes) just before battle to outnumber and overwhelm her opponents.
Monster.DuringCombat: Alviana prefers to stay out of direct combat, hiding either invisibly or in animal form, summoning creatures to eliminate foes.
Monster.Morale: Alviana flees if in serious danger, preferably by becoming invisible or using wild shape to become a bat.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure serious wounds, scroll of ice storm, wand of chill metal (10 charges), goodberries (8)
Monster.OtherGear: +1 hide armor, scimitar, sling with 10 bullets, pearl of power (1st level), Umbrae-Token, 120 gp

Monster.Name: Tal Taval
Monster.SpellsPrepared: Spells Prepared (CL 1st; concentration +4) 1st-jump
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 6, Dex 15, Con 10, Int 15, Wis 16, Cha 12
Monster.Feats: Deadly Aim, Dodge, Endurance, Fleet, Great Fortitude, Mobility, Point-Blank Shot, Shot on the Run
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +12, Bluff +14, Climb +10, Knowledge (geography) +15, Knowledge (nature) +15, Perception +16, Perform (oratory) +14, Sense Motive +16, Stealth +14, Survival +16, Swim +10
Monster.SQ: favored terrain (water +2), hunter's bond (dog animal companion named Blue), rogue talents (fast stealth, resiliency, stand up), track +2, trapfinding +3, wild empathy +7
Monster.BeforeCombat: If Tal expects combat, he casts jump on himself so that he can easily leap from his barge to shore or vice versa. If he thinks he's coming into dangerous territory, he uses his fast stealth rogue ability to sneak up on enemies so that he can fire arrows from concealment.
Monster.DuringCombat: Tal prefers to fight from his barge, forcing opponents to swim to him. He relies on his speed and mobility to stay out of reach of his enemies. If forced into melee combat, he uses his dog (named "Blue") to flank so he can make sneak attacks.
Monster.Morale: Tal knows when it is time to run and is not above stranding foes on his barge with his anchor feather token, leaping away under the effects of his jump spell, and using his swan boat feather token to create another craft to escape in. But when defending innocents or fighting evil, he gives no quarter and never quits.
Monster.Gear: elixir of swimming, feather tokens (anchor, fan, swan)
Monster.OtherGear: +1 chain shirt, +1 longbow with 20 arrows, masterwork short sword, amulet of natural armor +1, boots of the winterlands, cloak of resistance +1, ring of protection +1, 450 gp

Monster.Name: Rupert Raim
Monster.Melee: +1 longsword with godslayer blessing +12/+7 (1d8+7/19-20) or dagger +9/+4 (1d4+3/19-20)
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 16, Dex 12, Con 15, Int 10, Wis 14, Cha 8
Monster.Feats: Cleave, Godless Healing (see below), Persuasive, Power Attack, Shield Focus, Weapon Focus (longsword), Weapon Specialization (longsword)
Monster.Skills: Diplomacy +2, Heal +4, Intimidate +6, Knowledge (religion) +3, Perception +7, Sense Motive +7
Monster.SQ: armor training 1
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Feats To compensate for their lack of divine healing, the people of Rahadoum have developed the Godless Healing feat, a specialized technique to ignore injury. Once per day, when Captain Raim is at 25 hit points or fewer, he can make a DC 10 Fortitude save as a move action to heal 1 hit point per level (minimum 3). See page 123 of the Pathfinder Chronicles Campaign Setting.
Monster.BeforeCombat: Unless under immediate threat, Captain Raim takes his time to study and parley with opponents. However, he rarely gives enemy divine casters a chance to escape.
Monster.DuringCombat: Captain Raim concentrates his attacks on divine casters. Once he defeats them, he offers a truce to any surviving foes. He often pretends to be a dumb brute to mislead opponents.
Monster.Morale: Knowing that if killed he does not have the luxury of a divine resurrection, Captain Raim surrenders and lives rather than fighting to the death, though it galls him greatly to be humbled by a religious opponent.
Monster.Gear: half-plate, heavy steel shield, +1 longsword with godslayer blessing, dagger, longbow with 20 arrows, 63 gp

Monster.Name: Huodatha
Monster.SpecialAttacks: rage (19 rounds/day), rage powers (intimidating glare, roused anger)
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 20, Dex 13, Con 20, Int 8, Wis 10, Cha 12
Monster.Feats: Catch Off-Guard, Dodge, Extra Rage
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +5 (+9 jump), Climb +9, Intimidate +8, Knowledge (local) +0, Knowledge (religion) +0, Linguistics +0, Perception +7, Ride +7, Survival +5, Swim +10
Monster.SQ: fast movement
Monster.Morale: Huodatha retreats if his non-raging hit point total reaches 5.
Monster.Gear: potions of cure moderate wounds (2)
Monster.OtherGear: masterwork studded leather, masterwork greatclub, iron mask, 920 gp
Monster.BaseStatistics: When not raging, Huodatha's statistics are: AC 15, touch 12, flat-footed 13; Fort +7, Ref +2, Will +1; hp 38; Melee mwk greatclub +8 (1d10+4) or improvised club +7 (1d6+3); Ranged improvised club +7 (1d6+3); Str 16, Con 16; CMB +7; Skills Climb +7, Swim +8.

Monster.Name: Dimata Sirathini
Monster.SpellsPrepared: Spells Prepared (CL 2nd; concentration +4) 1st-entangle (DC 13), longstrider
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 15, Dex 18, Con 10, Int 8, Wis 14, Cha 12
Monster.Feats: Endurance, Iron Will, Point-Blank Shot, Rapid Reload, Self-Sufficient, Weapon Focus (scimitar)
Monster.Skills: Handle Animal +9, Heal +10, Intimidate +9, Knowledge (geography) +7, Linguistics +0, Perception +10, Stealth +12, Survival +12, Swim +6
Monster.SQ: favored terrain (jungle +2), hunter's bond (companions), track +2, wild empathy+6
Monster.BeforeCombat: Dimata readies her crossbow and looks for a defensible position, preferring high ground and deadfalls or other terrain that serves as a barricade. If necessary, she uses her Kaava musk to attract predators to the site of an ambush.
Monster.DuringCombat: Dimata prefers to stay at range and force enemies to approach her, preferably over treacherous ground. Once her enemies close in, she switches to her scimitar and first tries to eliminate anyone she sees casting spells.
Monster.Morale: Dimata is brave but not foolhardy. She tries to flee if greatly outnumbered or obviously outmatched. She uses her knowledge of the jungle to mislead pursuers and hide herself. If there seems to be no other option, she may try to surrender but is more likely to fight to the death than allow herself to be executed by bloodthirsty enemies.
Monster.Gear: potions of cure moderate wounds (2), elixir of hiding (2), elixir of swimming, Kaava musk (Sargavan "goop," see Pathfinder Chronicles Campaign Setting 130)
Monster.OtherGear: +1 studded leather, masterwork light crossbow with 20 bolts, masterwork scimitar, 310 gp

Monster.Name: Jaren the Jinx
Monster.DefensiveAbilities: bravery +1, evasion, trap sense +1, uncanny dodge
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 13, Dex 16, Con 12, Int 10, Wis 10, Cha 14
Monster.Feats: Acrobatic, Athletic, Dodge, Improved Initiative, Mobility, Weapon Finesse
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +10, Bluff +10, Climb +11, Diplomacy +10, Disable Device +7, Escape Artist +10, Knowledge (geography) +3, Knowledge (local) +4, Perception +9, Profession (sailor) +5, Sense Motive +9, Sleight of Hand +10, Swim +7, Use Magic Device +6
Monster.SQ: rogue talents (resiliency, stand up), trapfinding +2
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Jinx (Su) Any creature within 10 feet of Jaren who confirms a critical hit actually misses as if rolling a 1. Jaren has no control over who this affects or when it happens. Rotting Curse (Su) Jaren suffers from a rotting curse which afflicts him as mummy rot, but only when within 100 feet of Deadeye, Jessa, Nightscale, or Okonkwo.
Monster.BeforeCombat: Jaren tries to fight from higher ground, such as his ship's rigging or crow's nest, allowing him to sneak attack anyone climbing.
Monster.DuringCombat: Jaren uses Mobility to avoid being flanked and to draw opponents near his pirate allies.
Monster.Morale: Jaren loves his life of adventure and flees combat if he believes he'll be killed, jumping off his ship and swimming to safety if necessary.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure moderate wounds
Monster.OtherGear: +1 leather armor, +1 short sword, masterwork light crossbow with 20 bolts, 535 gp

Monster.Name: Lord Achimair
Monster.SpecialAttacks: blood frenzy, rage (15 rounds/day), rage powers (no escape, renewed vigor [1d8+6 hit points])
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 22, Dex 15, Con 24, Int 12, Wis 14, Cha 8
Monster.Feats: Great Fortitude, Intimidating Prowess, Weapon Focus (claw)
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +7, Handle Animal +9, Intimidate +13, Perception +15, Sense Motive +4, Stealth +13, Survival +11, Swim +31
Monster.SQ: fast movement
Monster.BeforeCombat: Lord Achimair uses water as cover while preparing to use his crossbow, then drinks a potion and moves into melee range.
Monster.DuringCombat: Lord Achimair uses his blood frenzy in conjunction with rage.
Monster.Morale: Lord Achimair believes he is unkillable by humanoids and fights to the death. If his opponents include a creature of at least Large size, he flees when his non-raging hit points reach 10 or fewer.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure moderate wounds, potion of protection from arrows
Monster.OtherGear: bracers of armor +1, masterwork heavy crossbow with 14 bolts and +1 shock bolts (4), 136 gp
Monster.BaseStatistics: When not raging, Lord Achimair has the following statistics: AC 18, touch 12, flat-footed 16; hp 65; Fort +11, Will +6; Melee +2 claws +11 (1d4+4), bite +10 (1d4+4); Str 18, Con 20; CMB +10; Skills Intimidate +11

Monster.Name: Adelle Duran
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 10, Dex 18, Con 12, Int 14, Wis 8, Cha 13
Monster.Feats: Combat Expertise, Dodge, Exotic Weapon Proficiency (falcata), Improved Disarm, Improved Initiative, Mobility, Spring Attack, Weapon Focus (falcata), Weapon Specialization (falcata), Taldan Duelist (see below)
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +17, Bluff +9, Escape Artist +13, Knowledge (history) +3, Knowledge (local) +3, Knowledge (nobility) +5, Perception +10, Perform (Dance) +13, Sense Motive +10, Swim +4
Monster.SQ: armor training 2
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Feats Adelle is skilled the art of fighting with the falcata (a type of Taldan sword) and buckler. When using this fighting style, her buckler's shield bonus increases by 1 and she gains a +2 bonus on Acrobatics checks. See page 137 of the Pathfinder Chronicles Campaign Setting.
Monster.DuringCombat: Adelle relies on her Combat Expertise feat to increase her Armor Class (–2 to attacks, +2 dodge to AC). With her Improved Disarm feat she disarms and taunts armed opponents, suggesting they surrender.
Monster.Morale: Adelle has no fear of death. Rather, the only thing she fears is boredom. Adelle will not withdraw against a clearly superior foe, but she may disengage if her opponent is obviously unable to best her and presents no interesting challenges.
Monster.Gear: potions of cure moderate wounds (3)
Monster.OtherGear: +1 mithral chain shirt, masterwork buckler, +1 falcata (Pathfinder Chronicles Campaign Setting 208), light crossbow with 10 bolts, ring of protection +1, 120 gp

Monster.Name: Tpannon
Monster.SpellsPrepared: Spells Prepared (CL 2nd, concentration +3) 1st-entangle (DC 12), summon nature's ally I
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 13, Dex 18, Con 14, Int 10, Wis 12, Cha 8
Monster.Feats: Desert Dweller (see below), Endurance, Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot, Rapid Shot, Weapon Focus (longbow)
Monster.Skills: Bluff +2, Climb +5, Diplomacy +1, Disguise +3, Handle Animal +6, Knowledge (geography) +5, Knowledge (history) +2, Knowledge (local) +2, Linguistics +2, Perception +9, Ride +10, Stealth +12, Survival +9
Monster.SQ: favored terrain (desert +2), hunter's bond (companions), track +2, wild empathy +4
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Feats Tpannon has the Desert Dweller feat, which grants him fire resistance 5 against effects that deal 5 or fewer points of fire damage (attacks that deal 6 or more points of fire damage affect him normally). He has a +4 bonus on checks made to avoid starvation or thirst and on Fortitude saves to avoid nonlethal damage from hot environments (this is in addition to the benefits of the Endurance feat). See page 139 of the Pathfinder Chronicles Campaign Setting.
Monster.BeforeCombat: Tpannon affects a jovial demeanor and keeps targets distracted while his troops deploy. He may summon an ally to help distract or flank opponents.
Monster.DuringCombat: Tpannon prefers to stay out of melee, not wanting to reveal that he's not as skilled a swordsman as the tales about him suggest. In keeping with his reputation as an excellent strategist, he normally uses his hunter's bond ability to advise his allies when battling humans or dangerous animals.
Monster.Morale: Tpannon flees if in serious danger, knowing he can always get more followers by relying on his extensive reputation.
Monster.Gear: +1 studded leather, masterwork longbow with 20 arrows, longsword, hat of disguise, unguent of timelessness (2), 125 gp

Monster.Name: Esme Currindon
Monster.SpellLikeAbilities: Bloodline Spell-Like Abilities (CL 3rd, concentration +8) 8/day-touch of destiny
Monster.SpellsKnown: Spells Known (CL 3rd, concentration +8) 1st (5/day)-alarm, charm person (DC 17), hypnotism (DC 17), unseen servant 0 (at will)-detect magic, detect poison, ghost sound (DC 15), read magic, touch of fatigue (DC 15)
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 8, Dex 13, Con 12, Int 14, Wis 10, Cha 20
Monster.Feats: Alertness, Eschew Materials, Lightning Reflexes, Persuasive, Spell Focus (enchantment)
Monster.Skills: Appraise +10, Bluff +11, Diplomacy +13, Intimidate +13, Knowledge (history) +7, Knowledge (local) +7, Knowledge (nobility) +7, Linguistics +7, Perception +8, Sense Motive +9, Spellcraft +7
Monster.SQ: bloodline arcana
Monster.DuringCombat: Esme is a poor combatant. If there is no one to protect her, she attempts to charm a likely protector and then flees combat, using unseen servant to close doors and move obstacles into the path of pursuers.
Monster.Morale: Esme quickly flees or gracefully surrenders if she believes she would be killed. She isn't frightened by battle; she just understands that she has no aptitude for it.
Monster.Gear: headband of alluring charisma +2, noble's outfit, 500 gp

Monster.Name: Cordeliza Parasca
Monster.Saves: Fort +1, Ref +6, Will +6; +4 vs. bardic performance, language-dependent, and sonic
Monster.Save_Mods: +4 vs. bardic performance, language-dependent, and sonic
Monster.SpecialAttacks: bardic performance 19 rounds/day (countersong, distraction, fascinate [DC 15], inspire competence +2, inspire courage +1)
Monster.SpellsKnown: Spells Known (CL 4th, concentration +7) 2nd (2/day)-animal messenger, pyrotechnics (DC 15) 1st (4/day)-alarm, charm person (DC 14), hideous laughter (DC 14), sleep (DC 14) 0 (at will)-dancing lights, flare (DC 13), ghost sound (DC 13), message, prestidigitation
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 8, Dex 14, Con 10, Int 12, Wis 14, Cha 17
Monster.Feats: Brew Potion, Extra Performance, Skill Focus (Perform [sing])
Monster.Skills: Appraise +6, Bluff +10, Diplomacy +8, Knowledge (arcana) +8, Knowledge (history) +8, Knowledge (local) +8, Perform (dance) +8, Perform (oratory) +8, Perform (sing) +13, Sense Motive +8, Sleight of Hand +9, Spellcraft +6
Monster.SQ: bardic knowledge +2, versatile performance (sing), well-versed
Monster.BeforeCombat: Cordeliza is not a fighter. She calls for help at the first hint of danger. When possible, she tries to head off an impending battle by using her social skills or casting charm person.
Monster.DuringCombat: Cordeliza screams for her family, local guards, or anyone in the area who might be able to help her. She uses pyrotechnics to cover an escape attempt and hideous laughter and sleep to disable her opponents.
Monster.Morale: Time spent gazing into the great beyond has left Cordeliza with a certain calmness about death. However, she has no wish to die just yet and tries everything at her disposal to flee when in danger. She bargains her services or possessions for her life but dies rather than betray her family.
Monster.Gear: potion of invisibility, wand of cure light wounds (5 charges)

Monster.Name: Fellnight Spriggan
Monster.Melee: 2 slams +4 (1d6+1 plus grab), gore +3 (1d8+1 plus grab) or prickle whip +3 (1d4+1) or battleaxe +3 (2d6+1 plus greenblood oil)
Monster.SpecialAttacks: prickle whip, thorn dart, size alteration, sneak attack +2d6
Monster.SpellLikeAbilities: Spell-Like Abilities (CL 4th; concentration +3) At will-flare* (DC 10), scare* (DC 12), shatter* (DC 12) 1/day-entangle (DC 10).
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 12, Dex 17, Con 18, Int 11, Wis 10, Cha 9
Monster.Feats: Combat Reflexes, Quick DrawB, Weapon Focus (slam)
Monster.Skills: Climb +0, Disable Device +5, Perception +0, Sleight of Hand +8, Stealth +2 (+10 in forested areas and thickets)
Monster.RacialMods: +2 Climb, +2 Disable Device, +2 Perception, +2 Sleight of Hand, +2 Stealth.
Monster.SQ: spriggan magic, thorn walk, thorny grasp, woodland stride
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Prickle Whip (Ex) Once per day, a Fellnight spriggan can unravel and detach from its body a whip-like strand of thorny bramble, as if it were drawing a weapon. This weapon counts as a whip of the spriggan's size, except it deals normal (not nonlethal) damage and is effective against creatures with armor or natural armor. The spriggan is proficient with this whip. The whip becomes brittle and useless after 1 hour. Size Alteration (Su) A spriggan can change its size from Small to Large or back again as a standard action, similar to using enlarge person except increasing or decreasing two size categories instead of one (doubling the modifiers to Strength, Dexterity, attack rolls, and AC). Spriggan Magic (Su) Spriggans have a +1 racial bonus to their spriggan spell-like ability DCs. Thorn Dart (Ex) Eight times per day, a Fellnight spriggan can pull a long thorn from its body, as if it were drawing ammunition. This thorn functions as a dart of the spriggan's size. The spriggan is proficient with this dart. Thorn Walk (Sp) This ability works like tree stride, except the Fellnight spriggan can only travel through thorny trees or pass harmlessly through a wall of thorns (or similar thornrelated effect) without harm. The spriggan can use this ability once per day. Thorny Grasp (Ex) A Fellnight spriggan's thorny body deals 1d4 piercing damage (1d8 for a Large spriggan) to a grappled opponent on a successful grapple check. A creature that grapples, pins, constricts, or swallows the spriggan takes this damage automatically on its turn. Woodland Stride (Ex) A Fellnight spriggan can use woodland stride like a druid, except it can also freely pass through areas affected by its own entangle spell-like ability.
Monster.BeforeCombat: The spriggans use woodland stride and their thorn walk ability to pass through the hedges and Tenzekil's wall of thorns unimpeded. They also use size alteration to grow to Large size.
Monster.DuringCombat: At Tenzekil's command, all three spriggans attack Elyin and the Foresthawks with their greenblood oil before attacking the PCs. They start with a volley of thorn darts and then grapple or wield prickle whips to snag townsfolk and drag them through the wall of thorns.
Monster.Morale: The spriggans fight to the death.
Monster.Gear: chain shirt, battleaxe, greenblood oil (2 doses)
Monster.OffenseNote: * These save DCs include a +1 racial bonus.
Monster.BaseStatistics: In its normal, Small form, a Fellnight spriggan has the following statistics: Init +5; AC 22, touch 16, flatfooted 17 (+4 armor, +5 Dex, +2 natural, +1 size); Ref +9; Melee 2 slams +4 (1d3–1 plus grab), gore +3 (1d4–1 plus grab), or prickle whip +3 (1d2–1), or battleaxe +3 (1d6–1 plus greenblood oil); Ranged thorn dart +9 (1d3–1); Space 5 ft., Reach 5 ft.; Str 8, Dex 21; CMB +1, CMD 16; Skills Disable Device +7, Sleight of Hand +10, Stealth +10 (+18 in forested areas and thickets)

Monster.Name: Devarre Snowgaard
Monster.SpellsPrepared: Druid Spells Prepared (CL 11th; concentration +12) 6th*-stone tell 5th*-call lightning storm (DC 19), commune with nature 4th*-cure serious wounds, dispel magic, repel vermin, spike stones 3rd*-neutralize poison, protection from energy, remove disease, speak with plants, stone shape 2nd-barkskin, heat metal (DC 13), hold animal (DC 13), lesser restoration, soften earth and stone 1st-cure light wounds (2), endure elements, speak with animals (2) 0 (at will)-detect magic, light, purify food and drink, read magic
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 13, Dex 8, Con 10, Int 12, Wis 12 (currently 5 due to Wisdom damage), Cha 14
Monster.Feats: Animal Affinity, Brew Potion, Diehard, Endurance, Natural Spell, Self-Sufficient, Toughness
Monster.Skills: Craft (carpentry) +6, Diplomacy +6, Handle Animal +20, Heal +12, Knowledge (history) +7, Knowledge (local) +7, Knowledge (nature) +17, Linguistics +3, Perception +9, Ride -1, Survival +21, Use Magic Device +13
Monster.SQ: nature bond (wolf companion named Aspen), nature sense, trackless step, wild empathy +13, woodland stride
Monster.BeforeCombat: When the PCs first arrive, Gossamere forces Devarre to protect himself with barkskin.
Monster.DuringCombat: The will-o'-wisp casts heat metal, then attacks with Devarre's +1 frost scimitar; it doesn't realize the cold of the weapon ifies some of the fire damage from the heat metal spell. During each round of battle, Devarre fights against Gossamere's compulsions, but cannot break free unless the PCs drive it from his body. Because of this mental battle, the PCs can continue to make DC 15 Sense Motive checks to determine something odd about his behavior. Any attack against Devarre deals half damage to Gossamere as well.
Monster.Morale: If Gossamere is reduced to 20 hit points or fewer, the will-o'-wisp abandons the druid's body and tries to flee.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure moderate wounds, potion of cure serious wounds, potion of lesser restoration (2)
Monster.OtherGear: masterwork ironwood splint mail, +1 heavy wooden shield, +1 frost scimitar, sling and 20 bullets, 93 gp.
Monster.OffenseNote: * Indicates a level of spells unavailable due to Wisdom damage.
Monster.BaseStatistics: When not possessed by the will-o'-wisp, Devarre's statistics are as follows: Will +11; Wis 19; Skills Heal +15, Perception +12, Survival +24.

Monster.Name: Tenzekil Braybittle
Monster.Melee: mwk club +10/+5 (1d4+2) or flame blade +9/+4 touch (1d8+4 fire)
Monster.SpellLikeAbilities: Spell-Like Abilities (CL 9th; concentration +9) 1/day-dancing lights, ghost sound (DC 10), prestidigitation, speak with animals
Monster.SpellsPrepared: Spells Prepared (CL 9th; concentration +12) 5th-stoneskin 4th-air walk, dispel magic 3rd-call lightning (DC 16), greater magic fang, poison (DC 16), protection from energy 2nd-animal messenger, barkskin, bull's strength, flame blade, flaming sphere (DC 15) 1st-calm animals (DC 14), charm animal (DC 14), longstrider, produce flame, shillelagh 0 (at will)-detect poison, know direction, mending, resistance
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 15, Dex 15, Con 14, Int 10, Wis 16, Cha 10
Monster.Feats: Combat Casting, Natural Spell, Toughness, Vermin Companion (Pathf inder Chronicles Campaign Setting, allows him to have a vermin animal companion), Vermin Heart (Pathf inder Chronicles Campaign Setting, allows him to affect vermin with spells and wild empathy)
Monster.Skills: Climb +6, Craft (alchemy) +9, Fly +9, Handle Animal +8, Heal +8, Knowledge (geography) +4, Knowledge (local) +3, Knowledge (nature) +10, Perception +10, Profession (beekeeping) +17, Spellcraft +6, Stealth +8, Survival +10, Swim +7
Monster.SQ: nature bond (giant bee vermin companion named Fulvid), nature sense, trackless step, wild empathy +9, woodland stride
Monster.BeforeCombat: If Fulvid warns Tenzekil of the PCs' approach, he casts bull's strength, barkskin, protection from energy (fire), and longstrider on himself, in that order.
Monster.DuringCombat: Tenzekil casts air walk on the first round, using his improved speed with longstrider to rise well above his swarming bees. From there, his Vermin Heart feat enables him to cast greater magic fang on Fulvid, sending the giant bee and his swarm after opposing spellcasters. He then casts ranged spells like call lightning, flaming sphere, and dispel magic to soften up his opponents. He casts stoneskin before closing with his flame blade or shillelagh.
Monster.Morale: Demoralized by his lack of success in stopping the PCs and having grown resentful of Rhoswen's cruelty, Tenzekil harbors second thoughts about sacrificing himself for her plans. If Fulvid and the bee swarms perish, the gnome visibly loses his resolve and curses the fey-queen, blaming her for costing him all he ever loved. Savvy PCs may use Diplomacy to convince him to abandon the fight. Tenzekil's attitude begins as Unfriendly rather than Hostile for such a check. If they persuade him to become Friendly, he surrenders. If they make him Helpful, he willingly aids their quest, hoping to undo the damage he caused. He tells them about the secret entrance to Rhoswen's palace at area H7 and gives them his scroll of antiplant shell and scroll of neutralize poison in the hopes they can use them.
Monster.Gear: goodberries (8), pearl of power (1st), potion of cure moderate wounds, scrolls of antiplant shell and neutralize poison
Monster.OtherGear: +1 leather armor, +1 light wooden shield, masterwork club, sling and 20 bullets, handy haversack, granite and diamond dust worth 250 gp (for stoneskin), 162 gp
Monster.BaseStatistics: Without barkskin, bull's strength, and longstrider, his statistics are AC 18, flat-footed 16; Speed 20 ft.; Melee mwk club +8/+3 (1d4) or flame blade +7/+2 touch (1d8+4 fire); Ranged sling +9 (1d3); Str 11; CMB +6; CMD 17

Monster.Name: Fulvid
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 20, Dex 18, Con 15, Int -, Wis 14, Cha 6
Monster.Skills: Fly +8, Perception +10
Monster.SQ: devotion, link, share spells, tricks (attack, down, guard, seek)
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Poison (Ex) Sting–injury; save Fort DC 18; frequency 1/round for 6 rounds; effect 1d2 Dexterity damage; cure 1 save. The save DC is Constitution-based, and includes a +2 racial bonus. Fulvid can sting only once; once it makes a successful sting attack, it loses 5 hp per round as if it were experiencing a bleed effect. If this bleed is stopped, it does not regain its stinger.
Monster.DuringCombat: Fulvid attacks whomever Tenzekil commands it to, using bite attacks.
Monster.Morale: If brought to 15 hp or fewer, Fulvid switches to sting attacks. Once it successfully stings, it continues with bite attacks until it is dead or Tenzekil directs it to stop fighting.

Monster.Name: Queen Rhoswen
Monster.SpellLikeAbilities: Bloodline Spell-Like Abilities (CL 11th; concentration +16) 8/day-laughing touch At will-fleeting glance (11 rounds/day) Spell-Like Abilities (CL 11th; concentration +16) 1/day-faerie fire, speak with animals, speak with plants
Monster.SpellsKnown: Spells Known (CL 11th; concentration +16) 5th (5/day)-baleful polymorph (DC 20), shadow evocation (DC 21), tree stride 4th (7/day)-bestow curse (DC 19), poison (DC 19), shadow conjuration (DC 20), summon monster IV 3rd (7/day)-deep slumber (DC 20), dispel magic, major image (DC 19), suggestion (DC 20), vampiric touch 2nd (7/day)-blindness/deafness (DC 17), detect thoughts (DC 17), hideous laughter (DC 19), hypnotic pattern (DC 18), levitate, minor image (DC 18) 1st (8/day)-charm person (DC 16), entangle (DC 16), mage armor, magic missile, shield, silent image (DC 17) 0 (at will)-arcane mark, dancing lights, daze (DC 17), detect magic, ghost sound (DC 16), mage hand, message, prestidigitation, read magic
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 6, Dex 16, Con 14, Int 12, Wis 10, Cha 20
Monster.Feats: Alertness, Combat Casting, Dodge, Eschew Materials, Persuasive, Skill Focus (Bluff), Spell Focus (illusion), Toughness
Monster.Skills: Bluff +12, Diplomacy +8, Intimidate +15, Knowledge (arcana) +15, Knowledge (nature) +9, Knowledge (planes) +6, Perception +5, Sense Motive +4, Spellcraft +15
Monster.SQ: bloodline arcana, woodland stride
Monster.BeforeCombat: Every day, Rhoswen casts mage armor for protection and tree stride to move about her palace, renewing them as necessary. If warned of approaching intruders, she augments herself with vampiric touch (targeting one of the "songbirds") and shield. Before her opponents arrive, she casts summon monster IV to summon an air elemental (which looks like a swirling cloud of smoke and shadow but is otherwise a normal air elemental).
Monster.DuringCombat: Rhoswen uses tree stride to enter the hollow columns of her throne room, using small holes to observe the fight. She casts baleful polymorph, deep slumber, and hideous laughter, and summons additional "shadowy" air elementals. She uses her staff to create a major image of herself in a far part of the room to distract her opponents and get them to use up resources. If discovered in one of the hollow pillars, she uses tree stride to get to another one, creating another illusion of herself if necessary.
Monster.Morale: If the battle turns against Rhoswen, she uses tree stride to flee from her throne room into the pillars of her bedchamber (area H23) to recover and prepare for a last stand.
Monster.Gear: crook of Cildhureen (10 charges), potion of cure moderate wounds (3)
Monster.OtherGear: thorn darts (5), headband of alluring charisma +2, ring of protection +2, greenblood oil (3)
Monster.BaseStatistics: Without her mage armor and shield spells, Rhoswen has AC 16, touch 16, flat-footed 12 (+2 deflection, +3 Dex, +1 dodge).

Monster.Name: Lady Kaltessa Iyis
Monster.MonsterSource: Princes of Darkness: Book of the Damned Vol. 1 44
Monster.Senses: darkvision 120 ft., see in darkness, see invisible or ethereal 120 ft.; Perception +30
Monster.DefensiveAbilities: cannot be flanked, freedom of movement

Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 8, Dex 10, Con 18, Int 17, Wis 28, Cha 19
Monster.Feats: Augment SummoningB, Command Undead, Craft Wondrous Item, Deceitful, Extra Channel, Improved Initiative, Improved Lightning Reflexes, Invested Magic, Lightning Reflexes, Scribe Scroll, Toughness, Quicken Spell
Monster.Skills: Appraise +23, Bluff +30, Diplomacy +23, Disguise +7, Knowledge (arcana) +17, Knowledge (planes) +22, Knowledge (religion) +27, Perception +30, Sense Motive +23, Spellcraft +17
Monster.SQ: heresy, imp companion (Ginarl), infernal bargain, infernal charisma, infernal transport, master conjurer
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Channel Hellfire (Su) As a free action 4 times per day, Lady Iyis can cause spells that deal energy damage to deal hellfire damage (half fire damage, half damage from evil energy). These spells gain the evil and lawful descriptors. Hellfire: Damage dealt from this accursed flame results half from fire and half from evil energy (which is not subject to being reduced by resistance to fire-based attacks). Evil-aligned creatures and those with the evil subtype take no damage from evil energy. Good aligned creatures and those with the good subtype take double damage from evil energy. Creatures under the effects of protection from evil are unaffected by evil energy, but still take normal damage from the fire. Hellfire Ray (Sp) Lady Iyis can fire a 75-foot-long ray of hellfire twice per day. This ray deals 10d6 points of hellfire damage. Any creature killed by this ray is damned to Hell, requiring non-evil spellcasters to make a caster level check (DC 10 + the dead creature's level) when attempting to resurrect the victim. Heresy (Ex) Lady Iyis gains a +4 on all checks made to research true names and sigils. Infernal Bargain (Ex) Devils summoned by Lady Iyis must make an opposed Charisma check or serve her for half the cost. Infernal Charisma (Ex) Lady Iyis gains a +5 on Charisma-based checks when interacting with devils. Infernal Transport (Su) When in Hell, Lady Iyis can cast dimension door twice per day or use both spells to travel as per teleport. Master Conjurer (Ex) Lady Iyis can bargain with a familiar devil she calls as a move action, adding +15 to her Charisma check. PC Gear Lady Iyis has equipment equal to a 20th-level PC. This increases her CR by +1. Venerable Age Lady Iyis is more than 100 years old, but retains her youth and beauty via a bargain with Mammon. She possesses all the benefits of venerable age but none of the penalties.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure serious wounds (2), scroll of summon monster IX (2)
Monster.OtherGear: Lady Iyis's nightskin (as nightskin but +5 glamered moderate fortification mithral chain shirt), +3 unholy spellstoring shortspear, staff of transmutation, amulet of natural armor +5, belt of mighty constitution +6, boots of speed, cloak of resistance +5, dusty rose prism ioun stone, eyes of charming, glove of storing (2; holding staff and shortspear), headband of inspired wisdom +6, mantle of spell resistance, pale green prism ioun stone, ring of freedom of movement, ring of protection +5, robe of eyes, 30,799 gp

Monster.Name: Nugrah the Decrepit
Monster.SpellLikeAbilities: Domain Spell-Like Abilities (CL 6th; concentration +6) 8/day-acid dart
Monster.SpellsPrepared: Spells Prepared (CL 6th; concentration +11) 3rd-cure moderate wounds, meld into stone, stone shapeD 2nd-barkskin, soften earth and stone D, summon swarm, spider climb 1st-cure light wounds (3), longstrider, magic stone D 0 (at will)-create water, detect magic, light, mending
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 11, Dex 9, Con 10, Int 12, Wis 20, Cha 10
Monster.Feats: Combat Casting, Iron Will, Natural Spell, Toughness
Monster.Skills: Bluff +6, Intimidate +6, Knowledge (nature) +12, Perception +14, Stealth +5, Survival +16
Monster.SQ: nature bond (Earth domain), nature sense, trackless step, wild empathy +6, woodland stride
Monster.BeforeCombat: As soon as Nugrah notices intruders entering the cellar, he casts meld into stone to step into the southern wall of area Z11c to listen and wait. While in the stone, he casts barkskin, spider climb, and longstrider (already included in his stat block). He then clambers out of the wall and up onto the ceiling to scuttle forward to see who's intruded in his den.
Monster.DuringCombat: Nugrah's first act is to use wild shape to assume the form of a wolverine, while remaining affixed to the ceiling 15 feet above. He swaps out cure moderate wounds to cast summon nature's ally III to summon a giant ant to attack the PCs, followed by summon swarm. Only then does he scuttle down to attack in melee. He does not pursue foes out of the cellar.
Monster.Morale: Nugrah fights to the death.
Monster.Gear: club

Monster.DuringCombat: Patronicus uses support spells on his allies, casts hold person, and attempts to dispel ongoing enemy spell effects.
Monster.Morale: If brought below 10 hit points, or if his allies are killed, Patronicus casts invisibility and flees.
Monster.Gear: wand of cure moderate wounds (15 charges)
Monster.OtherGear: +1 chain shirt, masterwork heavy mace, cloak of resistance +1, holy symbol, 736 gp

Monster.SQ: aura
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Disease (Su) Ghoul Fever: Bite–injury; save Fort DC 16; onset 1 day; frequency 1 day; effect 1d3 Con and 1d3 Dex damage; cure 2 consecutive saves. The save DC is Charisma-based. A humanoid who dies of ghoul fever rises as a ghoul at the next midnight. A humanoid of 4 Hit Dice or more rises as a ghast.
Monster.BeforeCombat: In his home, Halig has two guards (NE male ghoul fighters 1) nearby at all times, and is quick to summon them if he is in danger. If there are chattel about, Halig also summons them to fight at his side– even if only to distract his opponents for a moment.
Monster.DuringCombat: Halig uses his channel energy ability to heal himself and his undead allies or to injure living opponents. He targets his largest enemy's weapon with shatter, then casts spiritual weapon before joining the fray. He tries to paralyze as many opponents as possible.
Monster.Morale: Halig uses his darkness spell to flee if the combat turns against him.
Monster.Gear: potion of barkskin, potion of magic fang
Monster.OtherGear: masterwork scale mail, cloak of resistance +1, 650 gp

Monster.BeforeCombat: Elham prepares for battle by casting aid, bless weapon, and shield of faith.
Monster.DuringCombat: Elham avoids using spells in combat because she knows her casting is easily disrupted. If given space and a moment to breathe, she may cast helpful spells on herself or heal an ally.
Monster.Morale: Elham normally retreats at 20 hit points or fewer but fights to the death to protect followers of Sarenrae or when fighting evil undead, outsiders, or other enemies of the faith.

Monster.Name: Grigori
Monster.Saves: Fort +3, Ref +7, Will +4; +4 vs. bardic performance, language-dependent, and sonic
Monster.Save_Mods: +4 vs. bardic performance, language-dependent, and sonic
Monster.SpecialAttacks: bardic performance (8 rounds/day, standard action), countersong, distraction, fascinate, inspire competence +2, inspire courage +2, suggestion)

Monster.BeforeCombat: Grigori drinks one of his potions of undetectable alignment before any confrontation with the PCs.
Monster.DuringCombat: If the PCs attack him, Grigori casts calm emotions on them while he tries to rally the townsfolk to his aid. In combat, he casts grease on the PCs' weapons and hideous laughter on his attackers. He is not above using charm person to gain allies and bodyguards from among the townsfolk.
Monster.Morale: If reduced to 20 hit points or fewer, Grigori flees town (using invisibility or expeditious retreat, if necessary), only to return again later to continue his campaign against the PCs.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure light wounds, potion of cure moderate wounds, potion of undetectable alignment (3), scroll of scare, scroll of sound burst, caltrops
