* See the Advanced Player's Guide.
** See Pirates of the Inner Sea.

Monster.Name: Conchobhar Turlach Shortstone
Monster.SpecialAttacks: bardic performance 9 rounds/day (countersong, distraction, fascinate, inspire courage +1), hatred
Monster.SpellLikeAbilities: Gnome Spell-Like Abilities (CL 2nd; concentration +5) 1/day-dancing lights, ghost sound (DC 14), prestidigitation, speak with animals
Monster.SpellsKnown: Bard Spells Known (CL 2nd; concentration +5) 1st (3/day)-cause fear (DC 14), cure light wounds, hideous laughter (DC 14) 0 (at will)-daze (DC 13), flare (DC 13), know direction, light, summon instrument
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 10, Dex 14, Con 10, Int 13, Wis 10, Cha 17
Monster.Feats: Martial Weapon Proficiency (sword cane*)
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +7, Appraise +5, Climb +5, Perception +7, Perform (sing) +8, Profession (gambler) +7, Sleight of Hand +7, Stealth +10
Monster.SQ: bardic knowledge +1, gnome magic, versatile performance (sing)
Monster.DuringCombat: Conchobhar prefers to talk rather than fight. If he must fight, he lurks at the edge of combat, preferring to flank or attack with his bow.
Monster.Morale: Conchobhar flees if reduced to 7 hit points or fewer, but he fights to the death for any female character he is on friendly or better terms with.
Monster.Gear: oil of animate rope, wand of mirror image (11 charges)
Monster.OtherGear: shortbow with 12 arrows in wood quiver, sword cane*, black silk gloves, bottle of musky perfume worth 35 gp, fake eye patch, foppish clothing, outrageously foppish purple hat, yellow silk handkerchief, key to locker hidden down left boot; Locker (average lock, Disable Device DC 25) elixir of love, 42 gp

Monster.Name: Wormwood Pirates
Monster.Melee: cutlass* +3 (1d6+1/18-20) or dagger +3 (1d4+1/19-20) or sap +3 (1d6+1 nonlethal)
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 13, Dex 14, Con 11, Int 10, Wis 9, Cha 8
Monster.Feats: Athletic, Skill Focus (Profession [sailor])
Monster.Skills: Climb +7, Intimidate +4, Perception +1, Profession (sailor) +6, Stealth +3, Swim +7
Monster.DuringCombat: Wormwood pirates fight according to their loyalties. They always look out for themselves first, but aid those they are helpful to next.
Monster.Morale: A Wormwood pirate withdraws from combat when reduced to 6 hit points or fewer, and flees when reduced to 3 hit points or fewer.
Monster.OtherGear: throwing axe, cutlass*, dagger, sap, basic pirate clothes*, personal effects such as cheap earrings, leather belt, lucky rabbit's foot, hat with a parrot feather plume, etc.
Monster.Note: * See Pirates of the Inner Sea.

Monster.Name: Master Scourge
Monster.Melee: whip +6 (1d3 nonlethal+2) or mwk handaxe +7 (1d6+2/x3) or punching dagger +6 (1d4+2/x3 plus black adder venom)
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 14, Dex 16, Con 15, Int 10, Wis 12, Cha 8
Monster.Feats: Exotic Weapon Proficiency (whip), Improved Initiative, Intimidating Prowess, Iron Will, Weapon Finesse
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +8, Bluff +6, Climb +9, Disable Device +8, Intimidate +8, Profession (sailor) +8, Sense Motive +6, Sleight of Hand +8, Stealth +8
Monster.SQ: rogue talents (bleeding attack +1), trapfinding +1
Monster.DuringCombat: Scourge prefers intimidating opponents to fighting them. Once in combat, he attempts to attack from behind, flanking with his allies.
Monster.Morale: If reduced to 10 hit points or fewer, Scourge flees and tries to make good his escape. A man who bears a grudge, Scourge is certain to try to slip dark reaver powder or oil of taggit into the meal or drink of anyone who humiliates or injures him when the chance comes.
Monster.Gear: potion of blur, potion of cure light wounds, black adder venom (on punching dagger)
Monster.OtherGear: leather armor, punching dagger, masterwork handaxe carved with notches for kills, shortbow with 12 arrows in leather quiver with a buttoned shutter to protect them from the elements, whip, boatswain's call, corked dark green bottle containing 8 doses of oil of taggit, six gold teeth worth 5 gp each, hefty waxed coat with many hidden pockets, leather snuff box with a diamond stud worth 100 gp containing 1 dose of dark reaver powder, silver wedding ring worth 25 gp, 14 pp, 29 gp

Monster.Name: Owlbear Hartshorn
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 17, Dex 8, Con 14, Int 4, Wis 6, Cha 10
Monster.Feats: Catch Off-Guard, Intimidating Prowess, Throw Anything, Toughness
Monster.Skills: Climb +8, Intimidate +8
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Blind in One Eye (Ex) A character who makes a DC 10 Perception or Sense Motive check notices that Owlbear is blind in his left eye and very slow. If his opponent notices this and attempts to fight Owlbear from that side, that PC can make a DC 10 Acrobatics or Bluff check each round to easily avoid Owlbear's clumsy blows.
Monster.DuringCombat: Owlbear fights with his fists, dealing nonlethal damage until reduced to 15 hit points or fewer (see Morale below). If grappled, he attempts to break the grapple, but goes to back to using his fists as soon as he is free.
Monster.Morale: If Owlbear is reduced to 15 hit points, Plugg hurls a club in his direction. Owlbear naturally picks up the club and continues the fight with the weapon. If reduced to 10 hit points or fewer, Owlbear cries and tries to back away, but is pushed back into combat by Plugg and his mates.
Monster.OtherGear: handful of live crabs

Monster.Name: Rahadoumi Sailor
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 13, Dex 13, Con 12, Int 10, Wis 9, Cha 8
Monster.Feats: Athletic, Rapid Reload
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +5, Climb +7, Heal +4, Perception +3, Profession (sailor) +4, Swim +7
Monster.DuringCombat: The sailors fight in a well-organized way, firing their crossbows at any PCs attempting to board or cutting the grappling ropes as the PCs are attempting to cross. Once the PCs reach the deck, the sailors attempt to bull rush boarders over the side, then draw their short swords to defend their ship, working as a group to outflank opponents.
Monster.Morale: If reduced to fewer than 6 hit points, a sailor withdraws to the sterncastle (area B4) but continues fighting with his crossbow. If reduced to 3 hit points or fewer, a sailor flees or surrenders.
Monster.Gear: studded leather, heavy crossbow with 20 bolts, short sword, 10+1d6 gp

Monster.Name: Rahadoumi Officer
Monster.Melee: boarding pike of repelling +6 (1d8+4/x3) or mwk short sword +4 (1d6+2/19-20) and mwk short sword +4 (1d6+1/19-20)
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 15, Dex 14, Con 10, Int 13, Wis 10, Cha 12
Monster.Feats: Blind-Fight, Endurance, Great Fortitude, Improved Initiative, Two-Weapon Fighting
Monster.Skills: Climb +6, Intimidate +7, Perception +6, Profession (sailor) +6, Sense Motive +3, Stealth +6, Survival +6, Swim +6
Monster.SQ: favored terrain (water +2), track +1, wild empathy +4
Monster.DuringCombat: The officer orders the two sailors with her to attack the PCs while she tries to release the boat. She uses the extended reach of her boarding pike of repelling to keep attackers at bay.
Monster.Morale: If reduced to 5 hit points or fewer, the officer decides to take her chances with the sharks and dives into the sea.
Monster.Gear: chain shirt, boarding pike of repelling (+1 boarding pike; see page 58), heavy crossbow with 20 bolts, masterwork short swords (2), colorful clothing set with small pearls (worth 75 gp)

Monster.Name: The Brinebrood Queen
Monster.MonsterSource: Pathfinder RPG Bestiary 2 148, Pathfinder RPG Advanced Player's Guide 98
Monster.Senses: darkvision 60 ft.; Perception +8 (+10 in aquatic terrain)
Monster.Saves: Fort +4, Ref +3, Will +9; +4 vs. water spells and aquatic or water subtype abilities
Monster.Save_Mods: +4 vs. water spells and aquatic or water subtype abilities
Monster.SpellsPrepared: Druid Spells Prepared (CL 4th; concentration +7) 2nd-barkskin, chill metal, fog cloud 1st-entangle (DC 14), hydraulic push*, longstrider, obscuring mist, speak with animals 0 (at will)-detect magic, flare (DC 13), guidance, resistance
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 15, Dex 14, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 16, Cha 12
Monster.Feats: Combat Casting, Exotic Weapon Proficiency (harpoon), Power Attack
Monster.Skills: Escape Artist +8, Intimidate +8, Knowledge (geography) +4 (+6 in aquatic terrain), Knowledge (nature) +8, Perception +8 (+10 in aquatic terrain), Spellcraft +4, Stealth +16 (+18 in aquatic terrain), Survival +5 (+7 in aquatic terrain), Swim +16 (+18 in aquatic terrain)
Monster.SQ: amphibious, aquatic adaptation, natural swimmer, nature bond (Water domain), nature sense, wild empathy (aquatic) +5
Monster.BeforeCombat: The Brinebrood Queen casts barkskin and speak with animals before combat.
Monster.DuringCombat: The Queen uses her wand of summon nature's ally II to summon an octopus (she never summons a squid) to attack foes, then casts entangle against groups and chill metal against any armor-wearing opponents. The Queen stalks prey through the rot-infested soup of her lair, flanking with the Whale and attacking with her vindictive harpoon.
Monster.Morale: The Brinebrood Queen fights to the death so long as her beloved child survives. If the Whale is slain, however, she uses her jet ability to flee Riptide Cove for the deep waters of the sea.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure moderate wounds, wand of summon nature's ally II (12 charges)
Monster.OtherGear: vindictive harpoon (+1 returning harpoon; see page 59), lobster pot containing grindylow flensing knives including two masterwork daggers, a masterwork silver dagger, a rusting masterwork cold iron sickle, a scrimshaw blade of great workmanship depicting an octopus worth 125 gp, and 12 other blades of varying shape and quality

Monster.Name: The Whale
Monster.SpecialAttacks: swallow whole (1d8+7 damage, AC 13, 3 hp), tangling tentacles
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 20, Dex 10, Con 21, Int 9, Wis 10, Cha 9
Monster.Feats: Improved Initiative, Toughness
Monster.Skills: Stealth +6, Survival +6, Swim +19
Monster.SQ: amphibious
Monster.DuringCombat: The Whale's distended mouth enables it to swallow opponents whole, and its hunger drives it to this action, though it may regret doing so later. If a swallowed victim deals damage to the Whale, the giant grindylow vomits up its undigested meal on the following round as a free action.
Monster.Morale: Unable to leave the confines of the Cauldron, the Whale fights to the death. If the Brinebrood Queen is slain, the Whale flies into an incredible rage, focusing its attacks solely on the character who killed her, ignoring any other threats to avenge its dead mother.

Monster.Name: Ambrose "fishguts" Kroop
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 13, Dex 14, Con 11, Int 14, Wis 9, Cha 13
Monster.Feats: Catch Off-Guard, Great Fortitude, Skill Focus (Profession [cook])
Monster.Skills: Appraise +6, Bluff +7, Climb +5, Diplomacy +7, Disable Device +6, Intimidate +7, Knowledge (local) +8, Perception +3, Perform (oratory) +7, Profession (cook) +8, Profession (sailor) +5, Sense Motive +5, Sleight of Hand +8, Stealth +6, Swim +5
Monster.SQ: rogue talents (resiliency), trapfinding +1
Monster.DuringCombat: Kroop is no fighter, and prefers attacking opponents from behind, preferably with a sneak attack, rather than facing foes in a fair fight.
Monster.Morale: When the odds are against him, Kroop fights like a cornered dog. He feels he has nothing to lose, and rarely backs down. If protecting a friend, he is fiercely brave, and fights to the death.
Monster.OtherGear: padded armor, daggers (4), frying pan (improvised club), steadfast grapple (see page 59), bottle of rum, chicken, clay mugs (2), gold earring worth 5 gp

Monster.Name: Mr. Plugg
Monster.Melee: tidewater cutlass +8 (1d6+6/18-20) and mwk cat-o'- nine-tails +6 (1d4+1 nonlethal) or tidewater cutlass +10 (1d6+6/18-20) or mwk cat-o'-nine-tails* +8 (1d4+2 nonlethal)
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 14, Dex 16, Con 14, Int 13, Wis 8, Cha 10
Monster.Feats: Combat Expertise, Improved Disarm, Intimidating Prowess, Iron Will, Two-Weapon Fighting, Weapon Focus (cutlass), Weapon Specialization (cutlass)
Monster.Skills: Climb +7, Intimidate +10, Perception +2, Profession (sailor) +7, Sense Motive +2, Swim +7
Monster.SQ: armor training 1
Monster.DuringCombat: Mr. Plugg always enters combat with his cutlass and cat drawn, and has no compunctions about fighting dirty. He regularly uses Combat Expertise (–2 on attack rolls, +2 AC) to increase his AC, and if he finds that he is unable to hit opponents, Plugg drops his cat-o'-nine-tails and attacks with only his tidewater cutlass.
Monster.Morale: Plugg fights bravely, but if reduced to fewer than 25 hit points, he backs away. If reduced to 12 hit points or fewer, he attempts to flee, hoping to fight another day. He has no loyalty to his captain, crew, or allies, and abandons them without a second thought if it means saving his own skin.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure moderate wounds, screaming bolts (3)
Monster.OtherGear: tidewater cutlass (+1 cutlass; see page 59), masterwork cat-o'-nine-tails*, light crossbow with 10 bolts, amulet of natural armor +1, bracers of armor +1, shackles of compliance (see page 58), leather drinking cup, betting stash of 100 sp and 200 gp
Monster.Note: * See Pirates of the Inner Sea.

Monster.Name: Sandara Quinn
Monster.SpellLikeAbilities: Domain Spell-Like Abilities (CL 3rd; concentration +5) 5/day-copycat (3 rounds)
Monster.SpellsPrepared: Cleric Spells Prepared (CL 3rd; concentration +5) 2nd-instant armor* (DC 14), slipstream*, summon monster II 1st-command (DC 13), doom (DC 13), inflict light wounds (DC 13), obscuring mist 0 (at will)-bleed (DC 12), create water, purify food and drink, stabilize
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 13, Dex 12, Con 10, Int 10, Wis 15, Cha 14
Monster.Feats: Athletic, Combat Reflexes, Scribe Scroll
Monster.Skills: Appraise +4, Bluff +6, Climb +3, Heal +6, Knowledge (religion) +4, Profession (sailor) +8, Stealth +5, Swim +4
Monster.DuringCombat: If she is expecting combat, Sandara casts instant armor, which increases her AC to 17. Sandara takes every fight seriously, and once she gets started, she finishes things. She targets her opponent with doom and summons a small elemental or 1d3 dire rats to fight by her side.
Monster.Morale: Sandara is almost foolishly stubborn, a quality that might very well get her killed someday. She won't surrender and doesn't back down from a fight unless totally overwhelmed.
Monster.Gear: scrolls of cure light wounds (2), scroll of cure moderate wounds
Monster.OtherGear: heavy crossbow with 20 bolts, dagger, masterwork rapier, Besmara's tricorne (see page 58), clay pipes (3), ebony holy symbol of Besmara, pouch of Old Deep Rum-soaked pipe tobacco, tindertwigs (10); Locker 35 gp

Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +12, Bluff +9, Climb +15, Intimidate +11, Perception +11, Profession (sailor) +11, Stealth +12, Swim +23
Monster.SQ: rogue talents (bleeding attack +1), trapfinding +1

Monster.Gear: NPC Gear

Monster.SpecialAttacks: animate iron maiden, channel negative energy 7/day (DC 16, 3d6)
Monster.SpellLikeAbilities: Domain Spell-Like Abilities (CL 5th; concentration +8) 6/day-touch of darkness (2 rounds) 6/day-touch of law
Monster.SpellsPrepared: Cleric Spells Prepared (CL 5th; concentration +8) 3rd-bestow curse (DC 16), deeper darkness, dispel magic 2nd-blindness/deafness (DC 15; only to cause blindness), hold person (DC 15), inflict moderate wounds (DC 15), silence (DC 15) 1st-bane (DC 14), cause fear (DC 14), doom (DC 14), obscuring mist, sanctuary (DC 14) 0 (at will)-bleed (DC 13), guidance, mending, resistance

The animated iron maiden is a Medium animated object with AC 16, 36 hp, and hardness 10 that follows Evgenia's command (see page 14 of the Pathfinder RPG Bestiary for full statistics).

Monster.Name: Lucian Groy
Monster.Saves: Fort +6, Ref +1, Will +3; -4 vs. mind-affecting in areas of bright illumination
Monster.Save_Mods: -4 vs. mind-affecting in areas of bright illumination
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 14, Dex 8, Con 13, Int 12, Wis 9, Cha 4
Monster.Feats: Iron Will, Power Attack, Skill Focus (Perception), Toughness, Weapon Focus (light mace)
Monster.Skills: Climb +8, Perception +2, Profession (guard) +9, Ride +5, Swim +8
Monster.SQ: tallowthroat
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Tallowthroat (Ex) Lucian's advanced stage of tallowthroat has reduced his Charisma score to 4, and he suffers a –4 penalty on saving throws made against mind-affecting effects in areas of bright illumination. Any character who touches Lucian risks contracting the disease.
Monster.Gear: +1 chainmail, +1 light mace, masterwork light crossbow with 10 bolts, 44 gp

Monster.Name: Wax Golem
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 14, Dex 9, Con -, Int -, Wis 11, Cha 1
Monster.SQ: conditional sentience
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Conditional Sentience (Su) While some wax golems constructed to look like a humanoid gain sentience, genuinely believing themselves to be living creatures, Catalina's is still new enough that it has not yet become intelligent and willful. If allowed to persist, however, it would eventually attempt to live the life of a chandler's apprentice to the best of its ability. Immunity to Magic (Ex) A wax golem is immune to any spell or spell-like ability that allows spell resistance, with the exception of spells and spell-like abilities that have the fire descriptor. In addition, certain spells and effects function differently against the creature, as noted below. • A magical attack that deals fire damage slows a wax golem (as the slow spell) for 2d6 rounds (no save). In addition, for 3 rounds after being dealt fire damage, every time a wax golem uses its slam attack, it deals an additional 1d4 points of fire damage due to the molten wax. • A magical attack that deals cold damage breaks any slow effect on the golem and heals 1 point of damage for each 3 points of damage the attack would otherwise deal. If the amount of healing would cause the golem to exceed its full normal hit points, it gains any excess as temporary hit points. A wax golem gets no saving throw against cold effects.

Monster.Name: Ilquis
Monster.SpellLikeAbilities: Spell-Like Abilities (CL 8th; concentration +13) At Will-dancing lights, flare (DC 15), ghost sound (DC 15), light, mage hand 3/day-daylight, blindness/deafness (DC 17) Bloodline Spell-Like Abilities (CL 1st; concentration +6) 8/day-laughing touch
Monster.SpellsKnown: Sorcerer Spells Known (CL 1st; concentration +6) 1st (5/day)-charm person (DC 16), color spray (DC 16) 0 (at will)-bleed (DC 15), detect magic, open/close, prestidigitation
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 13, Dex 20, Con 19, Int 16, Wis 14, Cha 21
Monster.Feats: Deceitful, Eschew Materials, Flyby Attack, Improved Initiative, Persuasive, Weapon Finesse
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +16, Bluff +18, Diplomacy +7, Disguise +7, Escape Artist +16, Fly +18, Intimidate +7, Knowledge (arcana) +14, Knowledge (planes) +11, Perception +13, Spellcraft +11, Stealth +20, Survival +10
Monster.SQ: daylight door, poison use, ritual gate, bloodline arcana (+2 DC for compulsion spells)
Monster.BeforeCombat: If Ilquis has time to prepare for battle, he casts daylight and hides within the bright illumination the spell provides.
Monster.DuringCombat: Ilquis is invisible in bright light, a fact he uses to his tactical advantage. He casts blindness/deafness on rogues and spellcasters, then begins to sneak attack while vocally taunting the party.
Monster.Morale: If reduced to fewer than 15 hit points, Ilquis uses his daylight door ability to escape.
Monster.Gear: scroll of continual flame, wand of dominate person (CL 10th, 3 charges)
Monster.OtherGear: +1 dagger, 348 gp

Monster.Name: Fane And Oana
Monster.Saves: Fort +2, Ref +0, Will +1; -4 vs. mind-affecting in areas of bright illumination
Monster.Save_Mods: -4 vs. mind-affecting in areas of bright illumination
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 13, Dex 11, Con 10, Int 9, Wis 12, Cha 5
Monster.Feats: Great Fortitude, Skill Focus (Profession [farmer])
Monster.Skills: Climb +6, Perception +6, Profession (farmer) +9
Monster.SQ: tallowthroat
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Tallowthroat (Ex) Fane and Oana's advanced stage of tallowthroat has reduced their Charisma scores to 5, and they take a –4 penalty on saving throws made against mind-affecting effects in areas of bright illumination. A character touching either thrall risks contracting the disease.
Monster.DuringCombat: Fane and Oana don't want to see any harm befall Ilquis, but they are not trained in the ways of combat and fight only haphazardly to protect him.
Monster.Morale: Though afflicted with tallowthroat and charmed by Ilquis, Fane and Oana are not stupid and surrender if reduced to below half their total hit points.
Monster.Gear: leather armor, club, 15 gp

Monster.Name: Animated Furniture
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 10, Dex 12, Con -, Int -, Wis 1, Cha 1
Monster.SQ: construction points (faster)

Monster.Name: Elenuta
Monster.SpellLikeAbilities: Spell-Like Abilities (CL 5th, concentration +9) 1/day-disguise self (humanoid only)
Monster.SpellsKnown: Sorcerer Spells Known (CL 5th; concentration +9) 2nd (5/day)-blindness/deafness (DC 18), darkvision, hideous laughter (DC 16) 1st (7/day)-cause fear (DC 17), mage armor, magic missile, obscuring mist, ray of enfeeblement (DC 17) 0 (at will)-detect magic, daze (DC 14), ghost sound (DC 14), mage hand, message, resistance
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 8, Dex 15, Con 14, Int 12, Wis 8, Cha 18
Monster.Feats: Combat Casting, Eschew Materials, Greater Spell Focus (necromancy), Spell Focus (necromancy)
Monster.Skills: Bluff +12, Knowledge (arcana) +7, Knowledge (planes) +3, Perception +1, Stealth +9
Monster.SQ: nighteye*
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Bloodline Arcana Whenever Elenuta casts a spell with the darkness descriptor or of the shadow subschool, she gains a circumstance bonus on Stealth checks equal to the spell's level for 1d4 rounds. Shadow Blending (Ex) Attacks against a fetchling in dim light have a 50% miss chance instead of the normal 20% miss chance. This ability does not grant total concealment; it just increases the miss chance. Shadowstrike (Sp) Elenuta can make a melee touch attack as a standard action that deals 1d4+2 points of nonlethal damage and dazzles the target for 1 minute. Creatures with low-light vision or darkvision are not dazzled by this ability.
Monster.BeforeCombat: If Elenuta has time before combat starts, she casts mage armor and uses her last remaining scroll of false life.
Monster.DuringCombat: Elenuta casts obscuring mist to grant herself concealment and uses targeted spells such as blindness/ deafness, cause fear, and ray of enfeeblement against foes at range. If approached in melee, she uses her shadowstrike bloodline power until she has expended all its daily uses, before attacking with her quarterstaff.
Monster.Morale: Elenuta believes the PCs to be the Heart's latest trick and fights to the death, knowing that the midnight mirror gives no quarter when its minions attack.
Monster.Gear: potions of cure light wounds (2), potion of invisibility, scroll of false life, wand of magic missile (CL 5th, 12 charges)
Monster.OtherGear: quarterstaff, ring of protection +1

Monster.Name: Trakis
Monster.SpellLikeAbilities: Spell-Like Abilities (CL 3rd, concentration +3) 1/day-disguise self (humanoid only)
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 12, Dex 17, Con 14, Int 13, Wis 8, Cha 10
Monster.Feats: Dodge, Iron Will, Weapon Finesse
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +9, Bluff +6, Disguise +6, Escape Artist +9, Intimidate +6, Knowledge (planes) +3, Perception +5, Sense Motive +5, Sleight of Hand +9, Stealth +11
Monster.SQ: rogue talents (finesse rogue), trapfinding +1
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Shadow Blending (Su) Attacks against a fetchling in dim light have a 50% miss chance instead of the normal 20% miss chance. This ability does not grant total concealment; it just increases the miss chance.
Monster.DuringCombat: Trakis has not seen combat for many years now, but does the best he can. If an opportunity to flank presents itself, he takes advantage of it, but he does not go out of his way to set up the situation.
Monster.Morale: Trakis has been imprisoned in the midnight mirror for centuries and welcomes the chance to escape it in death.
Monster.Gear: masterwork studded leather, masterwork short sword, masterwork shortbow with 20 arrows

Monster.Name: Ghostfire Elemental
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 12, Dex 17, Con 14, Int 4, Wis 11, Cha 11
Monster.Feats: Dodge, Improved InitiativeB, Mobility, Weapon FinesseB
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +8, Climb +5, Escape Artist +8, Intimidate +5, Knowledge (planes) +1, Perception +7
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Numbing Cold (Su) When a ghostfire elemental deals cold damage to a creature, that creature must succeed at a DC 14 Fortitude save or be staggered for 1 round.

Monster.Name: The Heart
Monster.MonsterSource: Pathfinder RPG Bestiary 2 259, The Tome of Horrors Complete 737
Monster.Melee: bite +12 (3d6+8 plus 2d6 acid and grab), 2 tentacles +7 (1d8+4 plus grab)
Monster.SpecialAttacks: bristles (DC 20), paralysis (3d6 rounds, DC 20), swallow whole (2d6 acid damage plus paralysis, AC 19, 9 hp)
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 26, Dex 9, Con 22, Int 3, Wis 8, Cha 5
Monster.Feats: Improved Initiative, Iron Will, Lightning Reflexes, Power Attack, Skill Focus (Stealth)
Monster.Skills: Perception +7, Stealth +1 (+9 in undergrowth)
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Bristles (Ex) A tenebrous creature's head is covered in many small filaments that inject a deadly poison into any living creature that comes into contact with them. An opponent attacking a tenebrous creature with natural weapons or unarmed attacks must succeed at a DC 20 Reflex save or contact the many bristles that cover the tenebrous creature's head and be subjected to its poison. On a failed Reflex save, the opponent is paralyzed for 1d4 rounds. Immediately after the paralysis wears off, the opponent must succeed at a DC 20 Fortitude save or take 2d6 Str damage. A neutralize poison spell removes the effects of the poison and, if cast before an opponent makes its Fortitude save, prevents the need for such. Creatures with resistance to poison receive their normal bonus on their saving throws, and creatures immune to poison are unaffected by a tenebrous creature's bristles. Regeneration (Ex) Only damage dealt by a shard of the midnight mirror can suppress the Heart's regeneration ability. If the Heart would normally be killed by a different effect, it returns to life and full health after 1d4 hours.
Monster.BeforeCombat: The Heart is aware of everything that happens within the midnight mirror and cannot be surprised.
Monster.DuringCombat: The Heart is immobile and nearly mindless, so it fights using only rudimentary tactics, biting PCs and striking them with its tentacles until they leave its courtyard.
Monster.Morale: The Heart is inexorably connected to the demiplane of the midnight mirror and has no alternative but to fight until destroyed. If the Heart is reduced to 0 or fewer hit points while its regeneration ability still functions, it takes 1d4 hours to regenerate to its full capabilities and does not actively attack or waylay the PCs in any way during this time.

Monster.Name: Nicasor
Monster.Melee: +1 longsword +11/+6 (1d8+6/19-20 plus 1d6 cold), +1 short sword +11/+6 (1d6+6/19-20 plus 1d6 cold) or touch +7 (1d6 cold)
Monster.SpellLikeAbilities: Spell-Like Abilities (CL 4th; concentration +6) Constant-blur At Will-lesser shadow evocation (DC 15)
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 20, Dex 24, Con 22, Int 21, Wis 15, Cha 15
Monster.Feats: Dodge, Double Slice, Improved Two-Weapon Fighting, Two-Weapon Defense, Two-Weapon Fighting, Vital Strike
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +17, Bluff +12, Diplomacy +12, Disguise +9, Intimidate +12, Knowledge (arcana) +12, Knowledge (planes) +12, Perception +12, Sense Motive +12, Stealth +17, Use Magic Device +9
Monster.Languages: Abyssal, Aklo, Celestial, Common, Draconic, Infernal, Shadowtongue, Shae
Monster.SQ: armor training 1
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Lesser Shadow Evocation (Sp) This spell-like ability functions identically to the spell shadow evocation, but it can only create quasi-real versions of sorcerer or wizard evocation spells of 2nd level or lower. This spell-like ability is the equivalent of a 3rd-level spell.
Monster.DuringCombat: Nicasor is confident in his abilities, and he utilizes full attacks with both his swords whenever possible, unafraid to take the fight directly to his foes. If faced with formidable ranged combatants, Nicasor uses lesser shadow evocation to waylay his enemies with shadow versions of scorching ray and magic missile.
Monster.Morale: Nicasor, faced with no escape from the midnight mirror without the PCs' aid, fights to the death, seeing it as the only way to end his suffering if the PCs won't assist him.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure serious wounds
Monster.OtherGear: +1 studded leather, +1 longsword, +1 short sword

Monster.Name: Gruff Lantern Goat
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 21, Dex 16, Con -, Int 6, Wis 10, Cha 17
Monster.Feats: Alertness, Dodge, Great Fortitude, Improved Initiative, Improved Natural Attack (bite), Iron Will, Toughness, Weapon Finesse
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +11, Perception +19, Sense Motive +2, Stealth +14

Monster.Name: Auntie Gilga Baltwin
Monster.SpellsPrepared: Adept Spells Prepared (CL 3rd; concentration +5) 1st-command (DC 14), cure light wounds, sleep (DC 14) 0-guidance, mending, touch of fatigue
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 7, Dex 5, Con 6, Int 13, Wis 16, Cha 15
Monster.Feats: Catch Off-Guard, Cosmopolitan*, Spell Focus (enchantment)
Monster.Skills: Bluff +8, Diplomacy +5, Heal +8, Intimidate +8, Knowledge (local) +5, Sense Motive +8
Monster.SQ: summon familiar (Pickles, cat)
Monster.BeforeCombat: Not expecting a visitor, Auntie Baltwin casts guidance before answering the door. More likely than not, she expends the spell on her first Diplomacy or Bluff check. Not looking for a fight, Auntie Baltwin uses her social skills to negotiate this encounter, hoping to avoid detection, arrest, or violence.
Monster.DuringCombat: If pushed to fight, Auntie Baltwin uses her spells to incapacitate the PCs, starting with sleep. She uses command on any PC trying to attack or grab her. Otherwise, she screams for help while whacking the aggressive PCs with her cane or throwing a shoe at them, in hopes of stalling long enough for the district guard to come investigate. She can also have Pickles, her cat familiar, deliver touch of fatigue by brushing up against the PCs, then blending in with the dozen other cats in the room.
Monster.Morale: Auntie Gilga has no interest in dying and tries to escape using her potion of invisibility if the PCs become too violent. She immediately surrenders if reduced to fewer than half her hit points. Even after giving up, she still claims the PCs "started the whole thing."
Monster.Gear: potion of cure light wounds, potion of invisibility, scroll of cure light wounds, scroll of remove disease
Monster.OtherGear: 30 gp

Monster.Name: Deandre Dulay
Monster.SpellLikeAbilities: Domain Spell-Like Abilities (CL 1st; concentration +4) 6/day-touch of evil (1 round) 6/day-copycat (1 round)
Monster.SpellsPrepared: Cleric Spells Prepared (CL 1st; concentration +4) 1st-cure light wounds, protection from goodD, shield of faith 0 (at will)-bleed (DC 13), detect magic, stabilize
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 14, Dex 13, Con 10, Int 8, Wis 17, Cha 12
Monster.Feats: Dodge, Toughness
Monster.Skills: Heal +7, Spellcraft +3
Monster.SQ: aura
Monster.BeforeCombat: Putting on her mask, Deandre Dulay casts protection from good before whistling to her companions to attack.
Monster.DuringCombat: On her first turn, Deandre casts shield of faith, then rushes into battle to provide flanking opportunities for Larkin. In following rounds, she fights in melee range with Ledford, allowing Larkin to take advantage of the Gang Up feat. She heals herself or companions as needed and uses her copycat ability for added protection.
Monster.Morale: Determined to make a name for herself, pride forces Deandre Dulay to fight to the death. She goes down spitting curses and hurling insults.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure light wounds, potion of shield of faith
Monster.OtherGear: masterwork chain shirt, short sword, dagger, gray mask, unholy symbol, 28 gp

Monster.Name: Halli Fosta
Monster.SpellLikeAbilities: Bloodline Spell-Like Abilities (CL 1st; concentration +4) 6/day-acidic ray (1d6+1 acid)
Monster.SpellsKnown: Sorcerer Spells Known (CL 1st; concentration +4) 1st (4/day)-color spray (DC 14), magic missile 0 (at will)-bleed (DC 13), detect magic, light, message
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 10, Dex 14, Con 13, Int 12, Wis 8, Cha 17
Monster.Feats: Eschew Materials, Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot
Monster.Skills: Bluff +7, Intimidate +7, Spellcraft +5, Use Magic Device +7
Monster.SQ: bloodline arcana
Monster.BeforeCombat: Halli casts mage armor from her scroll before drawing the PCs into the alley. She triggers combat on Deandre's signal by casting her scroll of obscuring mist.
Monster.DuringCombat: Halli keeps her distance from the fight, preferring to use acidic ray from range. If she is threatened in melee, she uses color spray or her scroll of burning hands to eliminate any foes in range. If somehow depleted of spells or spell-like abilities, Halli resorts to her crossbow.
Monster.Morale: Distracted by her delight in the battle, Halli doesn't think to surrender or flee and gleefully laughs during combat, even up to the moment of her death.
Monster.Gear: potions of cure light wounds (2), scroll of burning hands, scroll of mage armor, scroll of obscuring mist, scroll of shield, scroll of unseen servant, wand of disguise self (5 charges)
Monster.OtherGear: dagger, light crossbow with 20 bolts, fan of pigeon feathers, small pouch of trimmed fingernails, 53 gp

Monster.Name: Larkin Waever
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 14, Dex 17, Con 12, Int 13, Wis 10, Cha 8
Monster.Feats: Combat Expertise, Gang Up*
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +5, Bluff +3, Climb +4, Disable Device +5, Knowledge (local) +5, Perception +4, Perform (comedy) +3, Sense Motive +4, Sleight of Hand +7, Stealth +5
Monster.SQ: trapfinding +1
Monster.BeforeCombat: Larkin waits for the signal before rushing in to strike the first available PC with his rapier.
Monster.DuringCombat: Unless Deandre and Ledford both threaten his target, Larkin shifts his position to flank, allowing him to make use of the Gang Up feat.
Monster.Morale: Larkin does not think this is a good day to die, and breaks and runs when reduced to 3 hit points. Given the chance, Deandre strikes at the turncoat.
Monster.Gear: elixir of hiding
Monster.OtherGear: chain shirt, rapier, dagger, notebook of jokes, ink, quill, small hand puppet representing Lord Gyr, 8 gp

Monster.Name: Ledford
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 17, Dex 15, Con 18, Int 10, Wis 12, Cha 10
Monster.Feats: Power Attack
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +7, Climb +8, Intimidate +4, Perception +7
Monster.SQ: fast movement
Monster.BeforeCombat: Eager to brawl, only Deandre's intimidation keeps Ledford from rushing in before her signal.
Monster.DuringCombat: On his first turn, Ledford begins his rage ability, moves to the first PC he can reach, and attacks using power attack. He maintains his rage for the following 6 rounds, but stops using Power Attack if his first two attacks miss a particular PC. If given a choice of targets, Ledford always chooses the biggest, strongest PC. Gleeful at finally being paid to fight people, Ledford shouts out taunts with each blow, followed with a short laugh. He clearly enjoys combat.
Monster.Morale: While raging, Ledford fights to the death. If fatigued at the end of his 6 rounds of rage and reduced to 4 or fewer hit points, Ledford offers to call the fight a draw. Disgusted with his performance, Deandre may strike the failed barbarian.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure light wounds
Monster.OtherGear: masterwork chain shirt, greataxe, block of wax in a metal tin, fine comb with a long handle, bottle of whiskey and four silver cups, 25 gp
Monster.BaseStatistics: When not raging, Ledford's statistics are AC 17, touch 13, flat-footed 15; hp 15; Melee greataxe +3 (1d10+1/x3); Str 13, Con 14; CMB +1, CMD 13; Climb +6

Monster.Name: Maurit Zergo
Monster.Melee: bite +4 (1d6+2 plus disease and paralysis), 2 claws +4 (1d4+2 plus paralysis)
Monster.SpecialAttacks: paralysis (1d4+1 rounds, DC 13, elves are immune to this effect), sneak attack +1d6
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 15, Dex 17, Con -, Int 17, Wis 12, Cha 14
Monster.Feats: Acrobatic, Weapon Finesse
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +11, Climb +8, Disable Device +9, Escape Artist +7, Fly +5, Knowledge (dungeoneering) +9, Knowledge (local) +9, Perception +7, Sleight of Hand +7, Stealth +9, Swim +8
Monster.SQ: trapfinding +1
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Disease (Su) Ghoul Fever: Bite–injury; save Fort DC 13; onset 1 day; frequency 1 day; effect 1d3 Con and 1d3 Dex damage; cure 2 consecutive saves. The save DC is Charisma-based. A humanoid of 3 Hit Dice or fewer who dies of ghoul fever rises as a ghoul at the next midnight; a humanoid of 4 Hit Dice or more rises as a ghast.
Monster.BeforeCombat: If the PCs befriend Maurit, she follows them into the dungeon, offering helpful advice, and waits near a particularly tasty looking PC for the party to become engaged in combat with another foe.
Monster.DuringCombat: While Maurit has manufactured weapons, she only uses her daggers or shortbow for ranged attacks when melee is impossible, much preferring to use her new natural weapons to take down her foes. Though hungry and ravenous, Maurit knows what Pathfinders are capable of, and attempts to paralyze all her foes before she begins eating any of them.
Monster.Morale: Maurit's condition is irreversible and she knows it. She fights to the death to get a meal.
Monster.Gear: potions of cure light wounds (2), potion of protection from evil
Monster.OtherGear: leather armor, dagger, shortbow with 20 arrows, masterwork thieves tools, opal worth 200 gp

Monster.Name: Blindheim
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 13, Dex 15, Con 15, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6
Monster.Feats: Improved Natural Armor, Toughness
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +6 (+10 jumping), Perception +6, Swim +9
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Blinding Gaze (Ex) A blindheim's eyes emit bright light to a range of 30 feet. Any creature in that area must make a DC 13 Fortitude save or be blinded for 1 hour. Blindheims can see normally in the light generated by their eyes, which illuminates a 30-foot spread with bright light. Creatures with light blindness or light sensitivity take the normal penalties within 30 feet of a blindheim that is using its blinding gaze. A blindheim can activate or suppress this ability as a free action. The save DC is constitution based.

Monster.Name: Fledzer
Monster.SpellLikeAbilities: Arcane School Spell-Like Abilities (CL 1st; concentration +3) 5/day-blinding ray
Monster.SpellsPrepared: Illusionist Spells Prepared (CL 1st; concentration +3) 1st-color spray (DC 13), disguise self, magic missile 0 (at will)-ghost sound, mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 11, Dex 16, Con 15, Int 14, Wis 12, Cha 11
Monster.Feats: Improved Initiative, Scribe Scroll, Skill Focus (Stealth)
Monster.Skills: Bluff +4, Knowledge (arcana) +8, Perception +4, Spellcraft +9, Stealth +17
Monster.SQ: arcane bond (ring), camouflaged step, chameleon skin, extended illusions (+1 round)
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Camouflaged Step (Ex) Skulks can pass through forest and subterranean terrain almost without a trace. Add +10 to the DC to track a skulk in these environments. Chameleon Skin (Ex) A skulk's racial bonus on Stealth checks comes from his ability to change the color of his skin complex or regular patterns like bricks and mortar. A skulk loses this conditional bonus if he is wearing armor, or if he wears any clothing that covers more than one-quarter of his body, as skulks can only change the color of their own flesh, not that of the things they carry. A skulk normally conceals small items behind his body; by putting his back to a wall and changing the color of his front half, he can hide these items because observers don't have line of sight to the items.
Monster.BeforeCombat: Fledzer hides in the darkness, blending in with the statue unless called out by the PCs or Tarka, in which case he reluctantly moves into the open to speak with the kobold or the PCs.
Monster.DuringCombat: No matter what the kobolds decide to do, Fledzer attempts to escape. A false prophet using the power of the Qadiran statue to manipulate the kobolds, he knows when it is time to abandon a con. The skulk uses his abilities to hide his treasure from both the PCs and the kobolds, and uses his spells and spell-like abilities to blind and stun the PCs to ease his escape. If a PC moves in front of the dragon statue, Fledzer activates the trap as a free action. If cornered and given the opportunity to surrender, he parleys for his life, willingly handing over the jade katana and his other treasures in exchange for his freedom.
Monster.Morale: Fledzer is more interested in saving his own chameleon hide than he is in maintaining control of the kobold tribe. If reduced to 8 or fewer hit points, he attempts to flee down the well in the northern portion of the room.
Monster.Gear: potion of blur, potion of cure light wounds
Monster.OtherGear: dagger, jade katana, spell component pouch, spellbook (contains all prepared spells as well as all 0-level spells, burning hands, magic aura, silent image, and ventriloquism)

Monster.Name: Nester Rees
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 9, Dex 13, Con 10, Int 14, Wis 10, Cha 9
Monster.Feats: Deceitful, Martial Weapon Proficiency, Skill Focus (Appraise)
Monster.Skills: Appraise +11, Bluff +7, Disable Device +7, Disguise +7, Knowledge (history) +8, Knowledge (local) +8, Linguistics +8, Perception +6, Sense Motive +6, Use Magic Device +5
Monster.Languages: Azlanti, Common, Dwarven, Elven, Osiriani, Polyglot, Sylvan
Monster.Gear: leather armor, sword cane

Monster.Name: Krenshar
Monster.Senses: darkvision 60 ft., low-light vision, scent; Perception +5
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 11, Dex 14, Con 13, Int 6, Wis 12, Cha 13
Monster.Feats: Improved Initiative
Monster.Skills: Intimidate +1 (+5 to demoralize), Perception +5, Stealth +10
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Skullface (Su) As a standard action, a krenshar can pull the skin back from its face, revealing the musculature and bony structures of its skull. This counts as using Intimidate to demoralize an opponent, and is an extraordinary ability. The krenshar can emit a loud screech while peeling back its skin, causing potent fear in a single creature within 100 feet that can see the krenshar. The targeted creature must succeedat a DC 12 Will save or become frightened (if the target has 6 or fewer Hit Dice) or shaken (if the target has more than 6 Hit Dice) for 1d4 rounds. A creature that successfully saves cannot be affected again by the same krenshar's skullface ability for 24 hours. This is a sonic, mind-affecting fear effect. The save DC is Charisma-based.
Monster.BeforeCombat: The krenshar uses the heavy undergrowth to best position itself for its nighttime assault.
Monster.DuringCombat: The krenshar silently approaches the nearest sleeping PC hoping to get an unsuspecting victim. After its initial assault the krenshar uses its skullface ability to demoralize any awake PCs. If faced with PCs using ranged attacks, the krenshar reenters the heavy undergrowth and tries to reposition itself for another attack.
Monster.Morale: Desperate for a meal, the krenshar fights to the death.

Monster.Name: Bog Mother
Monster.SpellsPrepared: Druid Spells Prepared (CL 2nd; concentration +4) 1st-cure light wounds, entangle (DC 13), shillelagh 0 (at will)-create water, detect poison, flare (DC 12), guidance
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 9, Dex 16, Con 8, Int 8, Wis 15, Cha 12
Monster.Feats: Toughness
Monster.Skills: Craft (trapmaking) +1, Handle Animal +5, Knowledge (geography) +3, Knowledge (nature) +5, Perception +8, Profession (miner) +4, Stealth +8, Survival +8
Monster.SQ: nature bond (animal companion), nature sense, wild empathy +3, woodland stride
Monster.DuringCombat: Bog Mother casts entangle, hoping to snare as many of the PCs as she can, though she leaves a path in front of her log free so Snap Jaw can attack unimpeded. On the second round of combat, Bog Mother casts shillelagh and enters melee combat. If she has taken no damage herself but Snap Jaw is defeated, she spontaneously casts summon nature's ally I to summon a poison frog; otherwise, she heals herself as necessary.
Monster.Morale: Bog Mother fights to the death, believing the PCs want to harm her "children."
Monster.Gear: wand of cure light wounds
Monster.OtherGear: club, 8 amethysts worth 150 gp in total

Monster.Name: Snap Jaw
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 15, Dex 14, Con 15, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2
Monster.Feats: Improved Initiative, Iron Will
Monster.Skills: Perception +5, Stealth +10, Swim +14
Monster.SQ: hold breath
Monster.DuringCombat: Snap Jaw violently bites the opponent closest to Bog Mother; if more than one creature threatens the kobold, it attacks the smallest foe.
Monster.Morale: While Bog Mother lives, Snap Jaw fights to the death. Once Bog Mother is defeated, Snap Jaw fights until its hit points are reduced to 5 or fewer, at which point it flees into the swamp.

Monster.Name: Ulionestia
Monster.MonsterSource: Pathfinder Campaign Setting: The Inner Sea World Guide 310
Monster.SpellLikeAbilities: Arcane School Spell-Like Abilities (CL 3rd; concentration +5) 5/day-telekinetic fist (1d4+1 bludgeoning)
Monster.SpellsPrepared: Transmuter Spells Prepared (CL 3rd; concentration +5) 2nd-pyrotechnics (DC 15), shatter, web (DC 14) 1st-animate rope, grease (DC 13), hold portal, mage armor 0 (at will)-acid splash, daze (DC 12), detect magic, message, ray of frost
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 10, Dex 14, Con 16, Int 15, Wis 10, Cha 10
Monster.Feats: Improved Initiative, Scribe Scroll, Spell Focus (transmutation)
Monster.Skills: Appraise +8, Disguise +3, Knowledge (arcana) +8, Perception +3, Spellcraft +8, Swim +8
Monster.SQ: amphibious, arcane bond (amulet), physical enhancement +1
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Enchantment Resistance (Ex) Gillmen gain a +2 racial saving throw bonus against non-aboleth enchantment spells and effects, but take a –2 penalty on saving throws against aboleth enchantment spells and effects. Water Dependant (Ex) A gillman's body requires constant submersion in fresh or salt water. Gillmen who spend more than 1 day without fully submerging themselves in water risk internal organ failure, painful crackling of the skin, and death within 4d6 hours.
Monster.BeforeCombat: Knowing this operation was set to happen today, Ulionestia put her physical enhancement in Constitution (this has already been included in her stats). She cast mage armor before the PCs arrived.
Monster.DuringCombat: Ulionestia initiates combat by dropping a glass as a free action to signal her allies of her oncoming assault and then casts pyrotechnics on the bar's torches to blind the PCs. She follows up with web and grease to hamper their movement while they pursue Shoalo as he attempts to escape with the Society's artifact. If she needs to make an escape, she casts shatter on the aquarium and dives into the harbor through the hole in the floor of the broken tank.
Monster.Morale: Ulionestia fights until Shoalo makes his escape or until she is reduced to fewer than 8 hit points. She flees through the shattered aquarium into the harbor if possible; otherwise, she leaves by whatever means she can.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure light wounds, scroll of spider climb, wand of magic missile (25 charges)
Monster.OtherGear: dagger, cloak of resistance +1, aquamarine amulet worth 50 gp, spell component pouch, 22 gp
Monster.BaseStatistics: When not under the effects of mage armor, Ulionestia has AC 12, touch 12, flat-footed 10.

Monster.Name: Shoalo
Monster.MonsterSource: Pathfinder Campaign Setting: The Inner Sea World Guide 310
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 12, Dex 13, Con 13, Int 9, Wis 8, Cha 10
Monster.Feats: Skill Focus (Perception)
Monster.Skills: Perception +2, Swim +13
Monster.SQ: amphibious
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Enchantment Resistance (Ex) Gillmen gain a +2 racial saving throw bonus against non-aboleth enchantment spells and effects, but take a –2 penalty on saving throws against aboleth enchantment spells and effects. Water Dependent (Ex) A gillman's body requires constant submersion in fresh or salt water. Gillmen who spend more than 1 day without fully submerging themselves in water risk internal organ failure, painful cracking of the skin, and death within 4d6 hours.
Monster.DuringCombat: The gillmen's first goal is to escape with the Pathfinders' artifact, and once they have it in hand, they withdraw until they get out the door, jumping into the water and swimming away. If the PCs block their exit or hold onto the artifact, the two focus their attacks on whoever stands in their way or possesses the relic.
Monster.Morale: If the gillmen haven't managed to grab the relic or can't escape, they fight to the death. As soon as they have the Azlanti artifact in hand, they attempt to flee.
Monster.Gear: light crossbow with 10 bolts, spear, small sharkskin pouch with Aspis Consortium emblem containing 30 pp

Monster.Name: Rhakis Szadro
Monster.Melee: +1 rapier +9 (1d6+4/18-20), bite +2 (1d6+1 plus trip and curse of lycanthropy)
Monster.SpecialAttacks: bardic performance 8 rounds/day (countersong, distraction, fascinate, inspire courage +1), curse of lycanthropy, sneak attack +2d6
Monster.SpellsKnown: Bard Spells Known (CL 2nd; concentration +4) 1st (3/day)-disguise self, hideous laughter (DC 13), grease (DC 13) 0 (at will)-detect magic, flare (DC 12), mage hand, lullaby (DC 12), summon instrument
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 16, Dex 16, Con 17, Int 12, Wis 14, Cha 15
Monster.Feats: Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Improved Initiative, Weapon Finesse, Weapon Focus (rapier)
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +12, Appraise +6, Climb +10, Diplomacy +11, Disable Device +10, Disguise +7 (+17 with disguise self ), Escape Artist +10, Knowledge (local) +11, Perception +11, Perform (comedy) +11, Perform (string) +9, Spellcraft +6, Stealth +12, Use Magic Device +7
Monster.SQ: bardic knowledge +1, change shape (human, hybrid, and wolf; polymorph), lycanthropic empathy (wolves and dire wolves), rogue talents (finesse rogue, surprise attack), trapfinding +2, versatile performance (comedy)
Monster.DuringCombat: If combat breaks out, Rhakis immediately shifts to hybrid form and uses bardic performance to inspire courage among the Prince's Wolves. He draws his blade and attempts to flank opponents to make sneak attacks, casting spells as necessary to hinder foes.
Monster.Morale: If reduced to 15 hit points or fewer, Rhakis shifts to wolf form and flees into the forest.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure moderate wounds, potion of invisibility
Monster.OtherGear: +1 studded leather, +1 rapier, masterwork dagger, thieves' tools, 253 gp

Monster.Name: Duristan Silvio Ariesir
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 17, Dex 16, Con 17, Int 13, Wis 14, Cha 10
Monster.Feats: Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Improved Initiative, Lightning Reflexes, Shield Focus, Toughness, Weapon Focus (longsword)
Monster.Skills: Bluff +11, Diplomacy +7, Intimidate +7, Knowledge (local) +8, Knowledge (nature) +8, Knowledge (nobility) +8, Perception +11, Ride +10, Stealth +10, Survival +11
Monster.SQ: armor training 1, change shape (human, hybrid, and wolf; polymorph), lycanthropic empathy (wolves and dire wolves), track +1, wild empathy +1
Monster.DuringCombat: Duristan focuses his attacks on the weakest enemies first.
Monster.Morale: When reduced to fewer than 30 hit points, Duristan attempts to shift into animal form, turning into a black wolf and fleeing out the back door. He passes through area F4, crosses the road to area F8, and then enters area F9 to inform Adimarus of the PCs' arrival. If cornered, Duristan fights until killed or subdued.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure moderate wounds, 20 silver arrows
Monster.OtherGear: +1 studded leather, +1 light steel shield, +1 composite longbow (+2 Str) with 20 arrows, +1 silver longsword, 158 gp

Monster.Melee: +1 darkwood club +7 (2d6+4), bite +3 (1d6+2 plus trip and curse of lycanthropy)

Monster.SpellsPrepared: Druid Spells Prepared (CL 5th; concentration +9) 3rd-call lightningD (DC 17), greater magic fang, poison (DC 17) 2nd-flaming sphere (DC 16), fog cloudD, gust of wind (DC 16), heat metal (DC 16) 1st-entangle (DC 15), faerie fire, obscuring mistD, produce flame, shillelagh 0 (at will)-detect magic, flare (DC 14), guidance, stabilize
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 17, Dex 15, Con 17, Int 12, Wis 19, Cha 8

Monster.BeforeCombat: Once alerted by the guards in area E7, Cybrisa casts greater magic fang and shillelagh, and drinks her potion of barkskin.
Monster.DuringCombat: Cybrisa casts entangle on the first round of combat, then uses her scroll of summon nature's ally III to summon 1d3 wolves to attack opponents. She tries to avoid melee combat, casting call lighting on entangled foes.
Monster.Morale: If reduced to fewer than 25 hit points, Cybrisa uses wild shape to change into an eagle and fly away.
Monster.Gear: potion of barkskin, potion of cure serious wounds, potion of lesser restoration, scroll of summon nature's ally III

Monster.Melee: +1 bastard sword +11/+6 (1d10+4/19-20), mwk dagger +10/+5 (1d4+1/19-20), bite +7 (1d6+2 plus trip and curse of lycanthropy)

Monster.SpellsPrepared: Ranger Spells Prepared (CL 5th; concentration +6) 2nd-bear's endurance 1st-longstrider, magic fang
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 17, Dex 16, Con 21, Int 10, Wis 12, Cha 10

Monster.BeforeCombat: Once alerted by the guards in area E7, Mathus casts bear's endurance, longstrider, and magic fang.
Monster.DuringCombat: Mathus attempts to intimidate and demoralize anyone who dares to enter Highthrone. Then he draws his weapons and attacks any foes brave enough to face him. If Cybrisa turns on him, he douses his blade with silversheen and shows her no mercy or quarter, and expects none in return.
Monster.Morale: Mathus must hold on to Highthrone at all costs, and fights to the death.

Monster.Name: Silverhide Rangers
Monster.Senses: low-light vision, scent; Perception +9 (+11 in forest)
Monster.Melee: bite +9 (1d8+5 plus trip and curse of lycanthropy), 2 claws +8 (1d4+4)
Monster.SpecialAttacks: combat style (natural weapon*), curse of lycanthropy, favored enemy (humans +2)
Monster.SpellsPrepared: Ranger Spells Prepared (CL 1st; concentration +3) 1st-magic fang
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 18, Dex 16, Con 17, Int 10, Wis 14, Cha 6

Monster.Skills: Climb +11, Intimidate +5, Knowledge (local) +3, Knowledge (nature) +6, Perception +9 (+11 in forest), Stealth +10 (+12 in forest), Survival +9 (+11 in forest), Swim +9
Monster.SQ: change shape (human, hybrid, and wolf; polymorph), favored terrain (forest +2), hunter's bond (companions), lycanthropic empathy (wolves and dire wolves), track +2, wild empathy +2
Monster.BeforeCombat: Once alerted to intruders in the temple, the Silverhides cast magic fang on their bite attacks.
Monster.DuringCombat: The werewolves charge on the first round of combat, then attack with claws and bites, focusing their attacks on prone opponents.
Monster.Morale: With nowhere to run to, the Silverhide rangers fight to the death.
Monster.BaseStatistics: Without magic fang, a Silverhide ranger's statistics are Melee bite +8 (1d8+4 plus trip and curse of lycanthropy).

Monster.Name: Demon Wolf Marauders
Monster.Senses: darkvision 60 ft., low-light vision, scent; Perception +10
Monster.Melee: +1 falchion +12 (2d4+10/18-20), bite +5 (1d6+2 plus trip and curse of lycanthropy)
Monster.SpecialAttacks: curse of lycanthropy, favored enemy (humans +2), smite good 1/day

Monster.DuringCombat: The werewolves attempt to bite as many of the PCs as possible to spread their curse of lycanthropy.
Monster.Morale: The Demon Wolves fight to the death.

Monster.Name: Adimarus Ionacu
Monster.MonsterSource: Pathfinder RPG Bestiary 198, 294; Pathfinder RPG Advanced Player's Guide 118
Monster.Senses: darkvision 60 ft., low-light vision, scent; Perception +8
Monster.Melee: +1 bastard sword +14/+9 (1d10+10/19-20), bite +7 (1d6+2 plus trip and curse of lycanthropy)
Monster.SpecialAttacks: cruelty (sickened, DC 12), curse of lycanthropy, plague bringer, smite good (antipaladin; +1 attack and AC, +3 damage), smite good (fiendish; 1/day, +1 attack, +7 damage), touch of corruption (1d6, 2/day)
Monster.SpellLikeAbilities: Spell-Like Abilities (CL 3rd; concentration +4) At will-detect good
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 20, Dex 15, Con 17, Int 10, Wis 15, Cha 12
Monster.Feats: Cleave, Great Cleave, Improved Sunder, Lightning Reflexes, Power Attack, Toughness, Weapon Focus (bastard sword), Weapon Specialization (bastard sword)

Monster.SQ: armor training 1, change shape (human, hybrid, and wolf; polymorph), lycanthropic empathy (wolves and dire wolves), unholy resilience
Monster.DuringCombat: Adimarus opens with his smite attacks, focusing his attacks on paladins or good clerics if possible. He uses his touch of corruption to sicken opponents who face him in combat, and tries to spread his curse of lycanthropy with his bite whenever possible.
Monster.Morale: Adimarus cannot lose a fight without losing authority and command over his pack, so he fights to the death.
Monster.Gear: +2 breastplate, +1 bastard sword, silver unholy symbol of Jezelda

Monster.Name: Vollensag Stalkers
Monster.Melee: mwk greatsword +10 (2d6+10/19-20), bite +6 (1d8+3 plus trip and curse of lycanthropy) or unarmed strike +11 (1d4+7), bite +6 (1d8+3 plus trip and curse of lycanthropy)
Monster.SpecialAttacks: curse of lycanthropy, rage (16 rounds/day), rage powers (powerful blow +2, superstition +3)
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 25, Dex 15, Con 23, Int 10, Wis 14, Cha 8
Monster.Feats: Diehard, Endurance, Improved Initiative, Improved Unarmed Strike
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +8, Climb +12, Intimidate +7, Knowledge (nature) +8, Perception +10, Survival +10
Monster.SQ: change shape (human, hybrid, and dire wolf; polymorph), fast movement, lycanthropic empathy (wolves and dire wolves)
Monster.DuringCombat: The werewolves rage on the first round of combat. They fight with their axes, biting only when given an easy opportunity to make second attacks.
Monster.Morale: The werewolves do not want the PCs dead–they want them to carry the Primals' threat back to Ascanor. As a result, they fight only until they have killed one of the PCs, or until reduced to fewer than half their hit points. At that point, they break off the battle, snarling a final warning to the PCs before running off into the woods.
Monster.Gear: masterwork dagger, masterwork greatsword, bracers of armor +2
Monster.BaseStatistics: When not raging, the werewolves' statistics are AC 18, touch 11, flat-footed 16; hp 63; Fort +8, Will +3; Melee mwk greatsword +8 (2d6+7/19–20), bite +4 (1d8+2 plus trip and curse of lycanthropy) or unarmed strike +9 (1d4+5), bite +4 (1d8+2 plus trip and curse of lycanthropy); Ranged mwk dagger +5 (1d4+5/19–20); Str 21, Con 19; CMB +11; Skills Climb +10.

Monster.Name: Tos Katun
Monster.MonsterSource: Pathfinder RPG Bestiary 2 183, Pathfinder RPG Advanced Player's Guide 128
Monster.Melee: bite +17 (2d6+7 plus grab and curse of lycanthropy), 2 claws +17 (1d8+7 plus grab)
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 23, Dex 16, Con 17, Int 8, Wis 12, Cha 12

Monster.BeforeCombat: Kamuy-Paro casts greater magic fang on Tos Katun before combat.
Monster.DuringCombat: Tos Katun tries to surprise her foes by changing from a small Tian woman into her ferocious hybrid form at the most appropriate moment. She fights savagely to survive and to protect Kamuy-Paro. Tos Katun despises the other bandits and does not fight beside them, preferring to stay with her master and guard him as he casts spells.
Monster.Morale: If wounded by an enemy, Tos Katun fights to the death.
Monster.Gear: masterwork studded leather, amulet of natural armor +2

Monster.Name: Kundal

Monster.SQ: change shape (human, hybrid, and wolf; polymorph), fast movement, lycanthropic empathy (wolves and dire wolves)
Monster.DuringCombat: Kundal rages on the first round of combat and then focuses on one foe at a time, attacking that person until she falls unconscious or dead before moving on to the next opponent.
Monster.Morale: If reduced to fewer than 10 hit points, Kundal tries to change into wolf form to flee into the wilderness. If cornered, he fights to the death.

Monster.OtherGear: hide armor, +1 greataxe, javelins (4), 11 gp

Monster.Name: Sitrakha
Monster.Melee: bite +13 (2d6+5 plus curse of lycanthropy), 2 claws +12 (2d6+5)
Monster.SpecialAttacks: combat style (natural weapon*), favored enemy (humans +4, animals +2), sneak attack +1d6
Monster.SpellsPrepared: Ranger Spells Prepared (CL 4th; concentration +6) 2nd-cat's grace (already cast) 1st-entangle (DC 13), longstrider (already cast)
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 21, Dex 22, Con 18, Int 8, Wis 14, Cha 8
Monster.Feats: Dodge, Endurance, Improved Natural Attack (claws), Power Attack, Step Up, Toughness, Rending Claws*, Weapon Focus (bite)
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +21 (+29 jump), Bluff +10, Climb +16, Linguistics +4, Perception +13 (+15 in jungles), Stealth +26 (+28 in jungles), Survival +13 (+15 in jungles)

Monster.BeforeCombat: Sitrakha casts cat's grace and longstrider before sneaking up and ambushing the PCs (these spells are included in his statistics).
Monster.DuringCombat: Sitrakha starts by casting entangle to catch as many of the PCs as possible, then charges anyone unaffected by the spell, targeting humans. He uses Power Attack against lightly armored foes and Step Up to stay with an opponent.
Monster.Morale: If reduced to 25 hit points or fewer, Sitrakha flees through the dense jungle, using his speed and woodland stride ability to outrun any pursuers. He heals himself with his wand and returns to finish off the PCs. If driven off a second time, Sitrakha licks his wounds and avoids further contact with the PCs.
Monster.Gear: potion of fly, wand of cure light wounds (15 charges)
Monster.OtherGear: leather armor, masterwork kukri (2), masterwork composite longbow (+3 Str) with 20 arrows, cloak of elvenkind, ring of protection +1
Monster.Note: * See Pathfinder RPG Advanced Player's Guide.
Monster.BaseStatistics: Without the benefit of any spells, Sitrakha's stats are as follows: Init +4, AC 20, touch 16; Ref +11; Speed 30 ft.; Dex 18; CMD 28; –2 to all Dex-based skill checks.
